Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: qwestcruiser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Almond Tree, room 105, 5 steps to the pool. Not a very big hotel/inn but that's what makes it nice. They had a nice little patio with 2 chairs and a table outside the room. Nice clean room with iron and ironing board in the closet and also in room safe and small refrigerator. The property itself is full of green trees and flowers if you're into that sort of thing, which makes it seem very private. Lots of sun by the pool though and they also have a hot tub. Happy hour daily 5-7 and 300 feet to Duval Street. If your traveling from the Key West Express like we did, it is about a 10-12 block walk. We walked it and checked in early. Cabs and pedicabs (guys driving you in a cart) are available all around. Also, if you want to rent a scooter, 2,4, or 6 person electric car, there is a place across the street to do this. My wife and I rented a 2 person car, which goes about 27 miles per hour. $85 for 3 hours, $100 for 5. It's any easy way to see the island and surprisingly not as much traffic as I expected. I would highly recommend renting one of these to see the island. We did the 3 hour and it was plenty. Had lunch at Louie's Backyard by southern most point marker. Great views at this place. Also, don't forget about some of the bars by the harbor where the Key West Express takes you. We liked the Conch Republic and sitting up on the top floor at the Turtle Krawl. I would recommend staying in Key West 2 nights if you can pull it off. I wish we could have tried snorkeling. The water is so turquoise clear, If we went to Key West again, we would definetly stay at Almond Tree Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ...”
Reviews.Author: LarsMorch
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, Excellent room, Excellent location for couples. Private Parking - which is important in KW :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rnbbhs
Reviews.Content: We didnt want to be near all the spring breakers, so this place was perfect. Felt like you were on a tropical island. They had happy hour every night with two free drinks per person and snacks. In the morning they served you breakfast. Extremely polite people. They even gave me discount on the nights stay. Can't complain about anything there!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Doug R
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas with my wife's parents. The pool and hot tub were perfect, and quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and provided a nice selection for breakfast each morning. The rooms were clean. We all agreed that we would return here when we hopefully visit Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Matt S
Reviews.Content: Far enough away from the madness for serenity, but close enough for a short stroll to the party. Great staff, friendly and helpful.First time at the Almond Tree, will not be our last. please don't change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, relaxing place with absolutely great amenities. Clean, Clean , Clean. Fresh, and comfortable. Couldn't fine anythin”
Reviews.Author: 1pamd
Reviews.Content: Really quite enjoyable. Nothing overlooked. Staff said new bigger baths on the way. This will a great needed improvement to an already great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scmilton9
Reviews.Content: As so many others, we didn't want to stay at a big hotel and Almond Tree was just right. My grown daughter and I took a girls trip . We flew to Miami,rented a convertable and drove to Key West.If you haven't done it,everyone should, at least once in a lifetime.We pulled into theAlmond Tree,one block off Duval and were welcomed by 2 nice folks at the desk.During our stay at this beautiful Inn,the staff was friendly and very helpful.Lending us umbrellas(the first rain there in months),giving us directions,good breakfast and happy hour and even making us massage reservations.We were in walking distance to everything but away from the crowds.Our king size room was right on the pool and spa.It was nice to have a small fridge in the room for my leftovers and REAL Key Lime Pie.The bed was very comfortable;mainly for our nap the day it rained :) Can't say enough good about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don and Diane K.”
Reviews.Author: ODingle
Reviews.Content: WE didn't want to stay at a big hotel, as we have many times. Saw reviews at this place, and are we glad we decided to stay there. Great location, but still secluded enough to feel away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street. The queen suite was beautifully decorated in key west fashion, and more spacious then I had hoped for. Breakfast was great and the evening happy hour was a great touch and start to great evenings on duval.The staff of Shay, cheryl and bruce were extremely gracious and helpful. Can't wait to go back.We will never stay at a big hotel again in key west and have found our place in the Almond Tree Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very Peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: daydreamer19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here. We stayed in room 110 which was a very peaceful location(we got a heads-up from a TripAdvisor reviewer)! Breakfast and Happy Hour were just right. Our King room was a little small but the bed was comfortable. My only negative would be the old, small TV in the giant armoir. I don't go to Key West to watch TV but for $300 a night I would expect a flat screen TV.

Reviews.Title: “Best ADULT stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: yz_enroute
Reviews.Content: This is one of the BEST of Key West. Beautiful, quaint, well kept, great lication, GREAT staff. If you are a traveler with kids, looking for Disney entertainment, Orlando is up north. If you are an uptight luxury traveler, this hotel maybe isn't for you either. You'll just complain that the showers are too small, no flat screen TV, etc, etc. If you are laid back, and love Key West for what it is, THIS HOTEL IS FOR YOU!! Enjoy the happy hour and continental breakfast by the pool, the ideal location to DuVal St, the small hotel size, reasonably priced parking lot, and gorgeous pool. It is a GEM of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Gem”
Reviews.Author: Shampoo21208
Reviews.Content: First time visiting beautiful Key West. Very confusing looking on-line for a place to stay - luckily I chose the Almond Tree Inn. Wonderful clean room, welcoming staff, and fantastic location (corner of Duval & Truman - the locals call "Truval". ) We would definitelty stay again & recommend to everyone. G. & J. Shamp February, 2012

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn, very peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Assedo1
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the excellent service we received on arrival. The rooms were beautiful, clean and the decor was tropical. The grounds are 1/2 block from Duval Street. It is located approximately a 20 minute walk from the Mallory Square where the sunset is beautiful. Breakfast was included, with happy hour at 5:00. We had a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: marivis1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this great property for 1 night and wish we would've planned for 2. Beautiful, peaceful grounds right off Duval Street. Far away enough from noisy action but close enough to walk if you want. The contnental breakfast was perfect and the happy hour very enjoyable. Everyone was very helpful in suggesting restaurants and directions. Very relaxing and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Capture the Key West style here”
Reviews.Author: Nick H
Reviews.Content: Best thing is the warm and tropical courtyard by the pool, very relaxing. Room was nice, clean and tropical feeling. The Almond Tree Inn is located right off the quieter west end of Duval Street not far from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Almond Tree Inn, two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: str8upjlc
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel with great atmosphere. Felt like you were in a small paradise away from everything. Nice pool and small inground jacuzzi. Staff was great and very friendly. Room was nice size, clean and well appointed with fridge and microwave. Shower and toliet area small. Nice continental breakfast and late afternoon happy hour with beer and wine and cheese and crackers. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay; excellent ambiance and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Nick1946
Reviews.Content: This is our third time to stay here, and we haven't been disappointed yet. Location is excellent. One block off Duvall St. Far enough away from the unwashed masses to be quiet, but close enough to walk when you want to get among them. The staff is most hospitable. Free breakfast is more than adequate for those who want a healthy breakfast, and there is a Denny's close by for the gluttons. Pool area has great ambiance for lounging about. My only complaints: wireless was a bit spotty in my room, but the room was the greatest distance from the office (reception was great around the pool and on the balcony); number of cable channels is a bit sparse. But who goes to Key West to lay around the room and watch T.V?

Reviews.Title: “A Free Bottle of Champagne and More....”
Reviews.Author: Starlove N
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a New Year's week vacation and we stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for 4 nights. We are very pleased by the nice little things such as a breakfast or nice Happy Hour snacks. When we came back from the beach on 12/31, we were pleasantly surprised by a bottle of champagne (Duval-Leroy) on the bed along with a party hat! What a nice touch! Pool was very clean and the overall facility was well maintained. Our room was #108 and it was located perfectly â€“ nearby pool but quiet and in private. The Innâ€™s location is conveniently located right off Duval street and is walk distance to major attractions in the town. It was a high season and the pricing was in a high-side for the Inn but, we both are satisfied by staying at the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mixmaster300
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a Christmas week in Key West staying at the Almond Tree Inn. This is our fourth Christmas trip to Key West and we chose the Almond Tree from reading reviews on TripAdvisor where we always check before traveling. We found the Almond Tree to be the ideal place for us meeting all of our needs. The location is just off of Duval street without experiencing the noise and traffic. One other thing about the location is that there is a laundry mat across the street. I know doing laundry is not high on the list of things to do while on vacation, but we packed light and about the fourth day, ran across the street, threw a load of clothes in and we were set for the remainder of the week. We also flew into Key West and did not rent a car, everything was in walking distance. Next door there is a pharmacy, a pizzeria and a sandwich shop if you want to lunch at the pool like we did. We found the Almond Tree to be very comfortable, clean and the staff attentive to all our needs. The morning breakfast covered a range of pastries, breads, bagels, juice, coffee, yogurt and fruit, just what we needed to start our day. In the afternoon there is a generous number of snacks for happy hour with coupons for two free drinks per person and if additional drinks are needed they are half price. The pool which is open 24 hours was very clean with the pool service coming on a regular basis to attend to the pool. The rooms are moderate in size, nothing flamboyant or fancy but clean. The landscaping is lush and attended to on a regular basis. We asked for a quiet room and stayed in room 110 which is on the first floor at the very end. There was no foot traffic and we were not bothered by any noise. Staff is on location from 7:00am until 10:00pm.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem near all of the Duval St action”
Reviews.Author: DrOfBytes
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based upon the high Trip Advisor rating and we couldn't have been more pleased! I could go on and on, but I'll get to the important stuff for the readers. Pros: 1. Clean beautiful rooms 2. Very reasonably priced 3. Close to all of the downtown restaurants, attractions and night life, just off Duval St. 4. Very friendly staff (thanks for everything, Alex!) 5. Beautiful pool and grounds 6. Small hotel, very peaceful. You don't feel like a number here. 7. Free happy hour 8. Did I mention the happy hour? 9. Complimentary continental breakfast We checked in after happy hour was over but Alex was kind enough to open up the bar for us anyway. Thank you Alex!! Cons: 1. Small shower and toilet area 2. Shower water pressure was low Would we stay here again? In a New York minute!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place for us”
Reviews.Author: bill c
Reviews.Content: We had 12 people in our group. The staff is friendly, flexible, accommodating-their whole attitude put us in relax mode. Special thanks to Alex and Bill-great hosts. Breakfast and happy hr are great. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Wanted for nothing. Location convenient to everything. Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in KW.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 123stitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for a couple of nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location is great, near the quiet end of Duval with the Hemingway House 5 min away. When we arrived, the cable system was not working properly and we were offered their sister property right away, but we were not in town to watch TV and decided to stay (the problem was fixed, as promised, the next day). The room (we had a King Deluxe) was lovely, very clean, and the bed was so comfortable. Breakfast - nothing fancy but perfectly adequate - and Happy Hour take place in the beautifully landscaped courtyard under the palm trees, and you could not ask for a nicer setting. A great place for a getaway - we wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Theetiquettorialist
Reviews.Content: We spent a night there and thought it was great...Location is perfect, in the middle of all that matters in Key West!! Small and cosy, good customer service and clean!

Reviews.Title: “Not everything working”
Reviews.Author: raidcan101
Reviews.Content: Were disappointed to find on arrival that the pool was closed for renovations, they did offer pool facilities at a sister property nearby. Room was adequate but only one small chair to sit on other than the bed. Entertainment cabinet with TV took up much of the space.. The ice machine by the pool did not work, the vending machine also did not work although it took coins then woudn't return them. Staff in office provided the bottled water we were trying to buy. A digital weight scale in the room had a dead battery. The continental breakfast and afternoon happy hour were appreciated. Hotel is close to many restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie59
Reviews.Content: Tucked just off of Duval Street, the location is perfect. We spent 3 days and didn't have to start the vehicle one time. It is close to everything, yet so relaxing and peaceful. We were there for our son's 21st birthday, so they wanted to be in the middle of the action of Duval, but we wanted to have some quiet time. The continental breakfast is wonderful, healthy choices and great coffee all served around the pool area. Happy hour from 5-7 with free cocktails and small hors d'ouevres (although it falls at the same time you should be heading to Mallory Square for the Sunset Celebration). The swimming pool was clean, a little chilly but it was December. There is a beautiful koi pond with a bench and waterfall. The pool/hot tub area is well kept, fresh towels on the chairs every morning, with the sound of the waterfall... so relaxing! The rooms are clean and spacious with a private balcony/patio area that has a table and chairs and a ceiling fan. Smallish bathroom area, but well kept. I can't say enough about the staff. To a person, they were attentive, polite and professional and really hustled to make sure your stay was perfect in every way. The Almond Tree Inn truly felt like a tropical resort, we look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: billpall
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel that is tucked away from the bustle of Duval Street although it sits very near Duval. The rooms were very clean, the bed and pillows were wonderful, the grounds were pretty and it had a spa and pool available. Parking was a nominal charge and the trolley was a 1 minute walk. The hotel is in the 900 block of Duval with many nice resturants and cafes close by and far away from the noise and masses of downtown Duval. Breakfast was ample and included in the room rate. Only negative was the TV didn't work too well and we had to go to a sports bar to watch our favorite college football games. We'd stay here again, without question.

Reviews.Title: “Best thanksgiving week ever”
Reviews.Author: SusanEliz86
Reviews.Content: Almond Tree Inn made our first trip to Key West one of my favorite vacations of my life! We stayed here almost a full week and it really felt like home after a couple days. We got 2 rooms for 4 people (my parents and their two 21+ kids), and each room was very spacious: 2 big comfy beds, with a couch/coffeetable/kitchenette area too with minifridge and microwave. What I really liked most about it in all respects is how detail-oriented and on top of everything the family who owns it was. They've literally thought of everything, from basic amenities to how the space is laid out. It's a gorgeous - lush yet perfectly pruned - tropical property with a pool, hottub, fountain, and outdoor table area for the complimentary breakfasts and happy hours they offer (amazing). Excellent location: blocks from all the hot spots on duval (the inn is only one block off duval street, but you've got to walk several blocks to get to the really rowdy parts - or can walk about 5 blocks in the other direction to get to the beach). We walked around a lot the first 3 days then ended up renting scooters, which was a super fun and speedy way to explore the entire island. Tips: *Request 2nd floor rooms for maximum quiet (our rooms were generally quiet but we were across from the maids station so could hear early morning cleaning/laundry/banging noises sometimes) *Make use of happy hour and breakfast, but don't forget to try some of the local brunch spots (blue heaven) and local happy hour favorites (green parrot) too *TIP the staff :) - I can't believe how low the rates are for how hard this four-person family works around the clock so that we can relax. Very impressive. Cons (sort of not even..) *I guess if you are looking for a resort, or anything beach/waterfront, this wouldn't be your place. But in that case, Key West itself probably isn't your ideal location either. *If you have a particular reason you're coming (e.g. heavy partying you can stumble home from, or lots of boating) you could easily stay in a location closer to a particular neighborhood - but I still think the inn's location provided the best balance for a well-rounded mix of tourism activities *Breakfast/happy hour definitely get repetitive as are mostly the same every day so if you stay as long as us, mix it up and go out on the town!

Reviews.Title: “So good I did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Dianne6
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to a very friendly welcome and the parking was great too. Rooms was excellent, huge suite, beautiful decor, comfy beds and super cleanliness. Small intimate hotel with lovely grounds and pool. Staff where friendly, informative and made sure you had all the information for a good time, tours, good places to eat ect. Good breakfast, brillant happy hour and ideal location right next to duval street plus right next door to the tram stop. Cannot wait to return and would highly recomend this hotel. Also good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Miles S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy walking distance away from all the major Key West attractions such as the Hemingway House, Southernmost Point, Butterfly Conservatory, Truman White House, Duval Street and museums. A secluded, private parking lot on-site is provided, and the inn is surrounded by a tall fence with a shrubbery hedge in front of it that really gives guests privacy around the pool. Rooms were nicely appointed and have the intimate feel of a bed and breakfast. They had a very nice spread for the continental breakfast. It is next door to a stop on the famous Conch Train tour, and an equal distance away from a moped/electric car rental place if you wanted to get around Key West in that manner. We would certainly stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway Place”
Reviews.Author: erick4k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying at my mother-in-laws in Ft Lauderdale for a week and we decided to take a last minute trip to Key West. Most of the hotels were booked but we found this place that had good reviews. BTW, this trip was back in Dec 2010 but never wrote a review and we also took our daughter w/us. This place was perfect. It was small and hidden. Its location was perfect, 1/2 block from Duval St. and easy walking to all the shops and to the Northern/Southern parts of the island. They also have complimentary continental breakfast and happy hour serving beer & wine under their pavilion. The staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean and spacious. There was a nice sitting area inside the room, a fridge and sink. The bathroom was clean also but the shower was a bit tight but nothing to complain about. Their was a nice sitting area outside our room on the 2nd floor which was perfect for us to hang out at night when our daughter was sleeping. All and all, this place was perfect and we will be staying here again next time we stay a week at my mother-in-laws house. I hope you enjoy it also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Charming!”
Reviews.Author: jackiezzzzzzz
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Good location and very helpful and friendly staff Room: quite clean, but the shower is a bit small according to north American standards. The sound-proof isn't that great, I kept on waking up at night by the "conversations" of our neighbours. Breakfast: Selection is small but delicious. Overall: I would recommand this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: kurtisq13
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean, quiet, fun and nice place to stay in Key West this is the place. It is located within walking distance to anything on Duval Street, yet you will not have to worry about being disturbed by the Duval Street activities. Staff is great and happy hour is quite fun.

Reviews.Title: “Well taken care of!”
Reviews.Author: GregChoti
Reviews.Content: We just concluded our stay at The Almond Tree and had a fantastic time. The staff could not have been more accommodating or friendlier. We were a part of a large group and they took such great care of us that everyone agreed that we would definitly stay there for our next trip to Key West. The breakfast and happy hour in the courtyard and pool area was great and certainly better than we expected. The room and bed were comforatble and although the bathroom was a bit small, we were all very satisfied. The location was also perfect - close enough to walk evrywhere but far enough away from the crowds and noise. Nice Job Almond Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: vls2002
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had decided not to book hotels in advance as we wanted flexibility while we were in Florida to move about as we wanted. We actually stumbled upon The Almond Tree Inn when our first choice of hotel was not available. The room was very comfortable (we were in 109) and we had a very comfortable king sized bed. The rooms is air conditioned and also has a mini fridge and microwave. There is a pool and hot tub and great little outdoor seating area. The best thing about this place is that it is right next to Duval Road where all the pubs and activity is. There was a modest breakfast included which consisted of bagels, pastries, juice coffee etc but it is very basic. But beware about Key West in October....!! We didn't realise that the last 10 days were dedicated to "Fantasy Festival" which was a bit of an eye opener and not for the feint of heart. It was very lively and great fun, but it pushes the cost of the rooms through the roof (you will be looking at least $300+ a night) and people were even offering to pay $600 a night!! Because of that reason alone, we felt that the cost of the room was a little too high at Â£216 a night, but to be fair that was pretty much the base going rate everywhere at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Lost it's sparkle”
Reviews.Author: Ruthebest
Reviews.Content: This is my 5 stay here over the years and since my last stay, i feel things have started to slip. Breakfast not as good, Happy Hour!! not so happy, vouchers for drinks, SHAME!! we never had all our vouchers given to us on check in, i was to ashamed to go and get them. Pool area clean with fresh towels, rooms clean, but showers need to be updated or at least the shower head, water drips out, no power behind it. Come on Almond Tree get it back on track or you will lose your old faithfulls to other places. I did check out others and for the same price you can get better, I feel sad typing those words, but it's true, not the same place i last wrote my review about.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: cshackle
Reviews.Content: We loved the Almond Tree Inn! Did lots of research before choosing this inn, and it did not disappoint. The service was outstanding from all of the staff; our room was clean, cozy and well-decorated; the courtyard grounds/pool were lush and relaxing. The day began with a tasty variety of breakfast offerings, and happy hour provided a much needed break from walking all day, with yummy snacks and adult beverages. The garden area provided a wonderful setting for meeting other guests and forming new friendships. Thank you for a wonderful stay--we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice staff and great setting”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1967_10
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for five of us and it was perfect. The hosts are fantastic and very, very helpful with suggestions about places to eat and visit. There is a small pool which served us well during the day and we enjoyed the happy hour(s) every night! The location is excellent - steps from Duval Street where so much of the action is. I'd stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and clean”
Reviews.Author: Alabamaretiree
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights in October. Excellent location (off Duvall) and very clean. Staff was helpful and swimming pool was very clean. Rooms were small but Happy Hour and Breakfast made up for it. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again -- can't wait to check out ... right now!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KGBtravels
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for three nights at this motel. I booked it after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. Well, I won't be doing that again ... or at least I'll read more of the negative reviews; at least you can believe those. We stayed in a King Suite on the ground floor. The people above us were so noisy (or were they just walking around?), that we felt the vibration of their movement in our room. You here the people talking next door. For this price, I don't want to hear other people! Bathrooms are super small. We're both normal sized people, but it is difficult to turn around. Maybe we're just spoiled from just having stayed at the Intercontinental in Miami. Geez, night and day! And it was cheaper at the Intercontinental. The food here is RIDICULOUS! This was probably the worst continental breakfast I have ever seen. Everything is miniature size and doesn't even taste good. You can't even get your own beverages. Orange juice from a fountain in a plastic cup. Very nice! Ok, something positive ... room was fairly clean; the cleaning staff and pool guy are nice. The lady behind the breakfast counter is nice. For happy hour you get drink coupons! Really??? Why not just have the alcohol available? Are they worried that people from the street are going to come in and try to get free drinks? The whole experience is just laughable. Tiny bits of cheese and a veggie tray! WOW!!! All in all ... Thanks but no thanks! There are better places to stay in Key West. You might pay a little more, but you get the service anyone deserves. This wasn't El Cheapo motel either. Oh, one more thing... if you're younger than 40, stay somewhere else. Weird crowd here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: bkheartnurse
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in Key West. Bill and all the staff at Almond Tree were fantastic. Beautiful place to stay, convienent location, and overall, outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, hospitable, intimate hideaway in the heart of old Key West”
Reviews.Author: Janedel
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 queen suite: spacious enough for 3: clean and nicely decorated. Best features: pool area with soothing sounds of waterfall, "more than" continental breakfast, pleasant happy hour with fresh veggie dips and cheese, location (leave your car behind and walk everywhere). More importantly: genuine service from owner down to all employees! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful accommodations and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: BuncoSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Almond Tree Inn which is on Truman Avenue, just around the corner from Duval Street. It was a perfect location. Far enough down Duval to be away from the noise and close enough to walk to everything. Alex was the front desk attendant when we checked in and he was most professional. He was kind enough to give us tips of places to go and coupons for those places. The accommodatios at the Inn were luxurious, the pool was perfect and the little happy hour they host was a great way to start the evening. Couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “If you are happy to stay in a motel - the Almond Tree is fine”
Reviews.Author: A-non-o-mouse
Reviews.Content: I guess this would suit people who are happy to stay in a motel - as that is what it is - a converted motel where the parking lot in the center has been closed off and a pool put in. I spent my first 2 nights in Key West here having found it on Tripadvisor and read the reviews. However, it's 'just ok' in my opinion. It's not remarkable in any way at all. It is certral - but being central isn't really important in a place as small as Key West. I went one block off Duval in either direction and found many other gems to stay at. Great BnBs and small hotels etc. People who like the Almond Tree would probably like the La Concha (chain hotel) too. If that is not for you, look elsewhere. For me the whole point of Key West is its quirky charm, colonial architecture, and uniqueness, which is elsewhere in abundance.

Reviews.Title: “Jailhouse didn't rock”
Reviews.Author: Florina007
Reviews.Content: I'f chosen this Hotel because of the good reviews. Now I don't know, if people just have no expectations?! At the start we found a very arrogant and brash young fellow at the reception. He din't give any information, except you ask especially for it. With his little attidudes he will never get his bum away from that island. That's no service! The room we were given was behind the stairs to get to the first floor. If you sit at the table in front of that room, you feel like a prisoner. (The receptionboy said: it is a very nice room - Hello?) The room inside is not bad two big beds and fairly enough space. However fat people will not be ablle to use the shower it's to narrow, but that's neglectable, because there is not much water coming down anyway from the rotten shower head. There is absolutely now daylight in this rooms! The Hotel has quite a prize, and they add 8 Dollars for the Parking. Very funny that they also add the taxes on that 8 Dollars, ridiculous!!! Why don't you ask for 10 $ and spare me the pennystories! There is a happyhour in that Hotel! But different from what we had in SoBe - where you can have any drink as much as you'd like - you are given two vouchers per person per night, wow! You get a glas of wine (awful quality), or a beercane, but not a whole cane of coke! No joke the enormously likable receptionboy explained the voucher is not worth a whole cane of coke - around the corner of the pool, they sell coke in a soda maschine for a dollar. I would never again make a reservation for that Hotel or any Hotel in Key West. There are too many very nice little vacationcottages you can rent just spontaneously, and the chance that you will not be treated like a dumm prisoner instead of a paying guest, is huge! It is a hotel where there is no host, and no charme. Happy hours are not possible there! Let me say something nice: the pool was clean!

Reviews.Title: “An "oasis" in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: TheBot77
Reviews.Content: In short - this is a super little place and well worth checking out, or maybe checking in! We recently visited the Keys and did a bit of shopping around before deciding on this great little place - I'd advise you do the same as for the same price the quality in Key West differs greatly. Really felt like an oasis in what can be a pretty hectic town. We experienced 2 different types of room on the stay and both were clean, roomy and functional. We were moved to a Queen suite (for the same price) which was, I must admit, better in upkeep and size - significantly bigger and away from the pool. The way the place is set up you feel that you are miles away from the hustle and bustle of KW. Pool is nice and well kept. Breaksfast is pretty basis but good nonetheless. As it was quiet we got some evening drinks tokens which was a real bonus - nice to sit under the plams before you hit dinner. Staff werre super friendly, attentive and knowledgeable about local tours etc. All very positive. Only things to note - not a family place as the pool is small and it's not really set up for kids (that's why we stayed) and the pool is 24hrs. If you can get a room that doesn't face onto the pool that's best - we heard some noise llate on but not too bad, but bad enough to wake us up.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: JB_Cleo
Reviews.Content: We had originally intended to stay at the Almond Tree Inn for two nights, but we LOVED it so much we re-booked for a third night and decided to enjoy our entire vacation time in Key West. The Almond Tree Inn was an absolutely pleasant and relaxing experience! The inn is situated in a perfect location, it is CLEAN, decor is beautiful and service was perfect! We started our mornings with complimentary breakfast (thank you SHAY) and spent out afternoons enjoying happy hour (thank you ALEX) - we had a BLAST!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay! Outstanding location! Unbeatable service!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline H
Reviews.Content: Right around the corner of Duval Street within walking location of everything, including the Conch Train Tour station, Hemingway House, Southernmost point, and yet when you are behind the wooden gate, you feel like you are at a retreat miles away amongst the tropical vegetation, pool, and fish pond. We had a queen suite with two very comfortable queen-size beds and a sofa that opened up for the three of us that included a kitchenette and internet. Breakfast was lovely served on the patio every morning (a nice variety of items to choose from). It was all the little extras that were unexpected and special, like finding bottled water and cookies in the room for our arrival, and iced green tea and chocolates out during the day. They really went out of their way to make everyone's stay special. At breakfast the first morning, my 4-year old grandson was asked if he would like a glass of chocolate milk. I explained that he had a hard time with dairy products and drank almond milk at home, to which the person serving breakfast replied, "I will buy some almond milk when I go out shopping today and have it for him at breakfast tomorrow." Sure enough, the next two mornings they had chocolate almond milk for my grandson at breakfast! That really went beyond our expectations! We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for 3 nights and hope to become repeat guests like some of the others we met during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila J
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find! Secluded tropical garden, pool,jacuzzi plus bar with free complimentary drinks!Rooms were extremely comfortable with bath robes, coffee machine,lots of fluffy towels and a king size bed! We took two suites for our family holiday but rooms othe rooms arond the pool were equally as comfortable.Continental breakfast was part of the deal but proved to be much more than basic continental. Staff could not be more helpful and accomodating - we had two small kids in our party and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place We've Ever Stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: lataskata
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree Inn is really the best place we have ever stayed, considering all things - rooms, atmosphere, location, and staff! We intially did not have a reservation and when we walked in the young man at front desk gave us a great deal on the King Suite for two nights. It is located in the perfect place right off of Duval Street, but far enough to get away from the hustle/bustle and noise. We were so amazed with the grounds itself - private area with beautiful trees all around make you feel like you are on a deserted island somewhere. That is how relaxing this place made us feel. We almost wished we could have taken one day out of our schedule to just spend an entire day relaxing by the pool. The grounds with the pool is absolutely beautiful with the water running in the fountains. Could not even hear any noise from the street outside. Every morning staff would make sure each sun chair had it's own towel ready for a dip in the pool. The continental breakfast was a definite plus and so was happy hour. Parking was easy access and we even rented scooters from right across the street and parked them there as well. The rooms were wonderful - very clean and stylish. We got the King Suite and it was very roomy. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was very clean and nice. Loved the walk in shower, albeit a little small was just right for an island destination. The staff was extremely helpful and super friendly. We had tons of questions of where to eat etc and they always had good suggestions and the best places to go. They also let us keep our car parked there after we had checked out so we could take one last scooter ride around the area. The things we loved the best about this place was definitely the atmosphere and the rooms! Would definitely stay here again if we ever come back to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Key West”
Reviews.Author: klpp
Reviews.Content: What's not to love? A great staff, clean and stylish rooms, relaxing pool and hot tub and a block off of Duvall....add a complimentary happy hour and a continental breakfast and you get the Almond Tree Inn. They even let us keep our car in the parking lot after check out as a convenience to us. More B & B s could learn from their hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlherk
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree Inn is a great small hotel. The location is perfectly suited for access to Duvall St. but far enough away from the noise and large crowds that congregate near the piers. The hotel has only 22 rooms but they are clean and the grounds are immaculate. The hotel provides a great breakfast daily along with a daily happy hour from 5-7 PM. The owners and staff are courteous and very friendly. It is a great hotel and a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pie1027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Almond Tree for three nights in July 2011. Cute place. Rooms were very clean. Pool was a nice size. Great location. LOVED the Happy Hour. Best thing about this Inn were the employees. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Both the woman (Shay?) who worked the front desk/handled morning breakfast & the man who worked the happy hour were very nice and answered any questions we had, they also made some very good recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again!”
Reviews.Author: AbqPrincess
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, good breakfast, fantastic location. Almond Tree Inn is less than a block from Duval street, so it's easy to go visit the restaurants and bars at night without having to worry about driving or parking. (oh! and it's right across the street from a laundromat, and next door to a shopping strip with a drugstore and pizza place) Despite being so close to the "action" the property is really quiet and feels secluded once you're on the grounds. The happy hour every evening with tickets for free drinks is a great idea, but we checked in too late one night, and were busy the next night of our stay, so don't know how it actually carries out. This place is expensive, but for Key West it's reasonably priced. They do charge for parking ($7 I think) and although the lot is small, we never had a problem finding a spot. Overall, not a 5 star resort, but very nice and a good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Little piece of paradise....”
Reviews.Author: NatMIA
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending a week at the Almond Tree with my fiancÃ© and our dog and we can't wait to go back. It became our favorite inn in Key West. The location is great... 1/2 from Duval, close enough to the action but not disturbing. There is a 24 hr. CVS, Pappa John's, Subway, and Dennys next to it, which is super convenient. The room was impeacable and super comfortable. The staff is amazing, friendly and make every effort to make your stay very pleasant. The property is kept really nice and beautiful. The only thing I would upgrade is the TVs in the rooms. We are even considering having our small, intimate wedding there because we like it soo much. Key West is a great place to enjoy a vacation with your pup and the Almond Tree welcomed him and we were very happy to take him around just call ahead the restaurants to make sure they allow pets in their patios.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Maryellen S
Reviews.Content: My new husband (we got married on this trip) and I have been visiting Key West a few times a year for many years. We have never been disappointed at the Almond Tree! From the cleanliness of the room (smells great!!), to the pool area and grounds, it couldn't be any better. Meeting old and new friends during Happy Hour is always fun, and the location next door to the CVS is very convenient. It's located just off of Duval Street, but once you are inside the gates, you can relax and enjoy the laid back atmosphere that makes Key West such a great place to visit. Many thanks to the wonderful staff - Shea, Alex, Bill and Jose, who do such a great job making us feel welcome and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to staff and management for a WONDERFUL stay!”
Reviews.Author: CarineBamps
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Almond Tree Inn. From the moment you enter that little green gate, you step into an extremely relaxing atmosphere. The staff, and especially the manager and owner, will do anything to make your stay enjoyable. They just want you to feel happy during your stay. We enjoyed the pool and surroundings, where there was nice music all day long. The rooms were very nicely decorated and super clean. The soap and toiletries were of high quality, very nice. It's a very quiet and relaxing place, while at the same time you're so close to everything there is to see on Key West, steps away from Duval! We also loved happy hour, always nice snacks and drinks in the afternoon. We do hope to be able to stay in the Almond Tree Inn again! The Morren family, Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Best place for us in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Bigimeyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here all five of us in Room 113 with a pullout sofa bed. Worked out very well. Great idea with the happy hour (sodas, beer, wine, apetizers for free!) and a very tasty breakfast included in a very reasonable price. Great location, close to Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great little place”
Reviews.Author: minny34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for 2 nights and it was a great choice. It's one block off Duval but on the quieter end, right around the corner from 915 (excellent) and a great little french bakery. We had one of the regular rooms; it was a nice-sized room with a small bathroom. The decor is tasteful and elegant, the amenities very good for the price of the hotel. There's a happy hour every day which is a wonderful way to relax, sipping a drink by the pool. We didn't try the breakfast as we wanted to go to actual restaurants. One of the things I really liked was that there's a gate separating the inn from the street. It made us feel as if we were in a ore private place, even though we were close to Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Suzie_Q000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just the one night but wished it had been much longer. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay- everything about the Almond Tree was great, situation, room " happy hour " and breakfast. Being able to park the car and forget about it for a measly $8 was great. Don't take any notice of previous negative reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Our Oasis in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: sandlappergirl50
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, Alex, Shay and Bill made us feel so welcome! Our room was just as requested and expected and very comfortable and quiet. When stepping beyond the gates, we were only about 50 yards from Duval and all the action, yet you'd never know it. They have cleverly made a Koi pond and waterfall provide just enough quiet, soothing noise to take the city sounds away. Happy hour wines, soft drinks and snacks were so special as well as the breakfast/brunch, wonderful coffee and fresh, fresh orange juice and we did appreciate management staying open a little later than most in the morning. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Den”
Reviews.Author: Jordanskills134
Reviews.Content: This was our second place to stay while we were in Key West. The Almond Tree is not really a bed and breakfast it is more like an Inn. I did enjoy the bath and body works assortment of shampoos and conditioners and also the pool. Please note that if you have children this is not the place for you. This hotel is filled with smokers. Smoking is pretty much allowed everywhere except for in the room. I had wished that they had a designated area for smoking. Breakfast wasn't very good as the portions were super small and I felt watched when I was picking up food. I felt as if I couldn't take the portion size that I had wanted. The employees were great except for one older woman who seemed to have a big attitude. We really had a pleasant experience with two younger men who were working in the lobby as they helped to find some places for sight-seeing and plain old fun. The bathrooms were very cramped and uncomfortable. We thought we had a PRIVATE BALCONY, but it turns out the the balcony is shared with others and is not PRIVATE. Our stay was okay, but like I said before there was too much smoke and it was overcrowded at times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but ask about the room location”
Reviews.Author: Wizardts
Reviews.Content: We were here for a couple of blazing hot days and the room A/C was marvelous. Good things: Terrific front desk staff. Good location, in between the southern pier and Mallory. Pool looked inviting and people gathered there. Free sodas in the late afternoons. Super-nice beds. Noise effectively sealed off in the rooms. You can rent scooters right across the street. Close to the Hemingway House. Parking cost, but it was hassle-free. Good shower water pressure, an issue down there. Good fridge. Bad things: We stayed hard by the laundry room and some kind of large and noisy generator from the drugstore next door. This affects four rooms, I'd say, and you don't want them. Not an issue inside the room, they had doubled glass or something. A bright yellow light shined in the window all night and the slat shades didn't block all of it. The bathroom (toilet area) was really small and narrow, same for the shower (the sink and grooming area was in the room). Housekeeping tried to get in even though the do not disturb card was in the lock. When the lady saw I was not dressed, she still tried to get in, as in get your butt out of bed. Unpleasant. Internet was free but spotty and at best it only worked in part of the room. Overall, I recommend the Almond Tree as clean, friendly and reasonably priced. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok - a clean place with well kept grounds - I think I expected a bit more based on TripAdvisor Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel2345
Reviews.Content: So we choose this place based on the reviews and it was avail when we checked on line.The staff was very friendly on check-in. The room was clean, spacious and open as described. Our room was not one of the rooms with a private balcony. We were on the second floor which has a very large porch with a lot of bistro style tables - not private. They would have accommodated a move but we didn't want to move again. It appears that all of the rooms on the first floor have a private and small balcony. The pool was fun, had had floatation devises. The grounds very well kept. Parking lot was right on the property which was a huge plus and was $8 a day. The location is one block from Duvall St. right in the middle of Duvall's Street length. Its only 4 blocks form the Butterfly Conservatory. My only turnoff was the breakfast. Not really meant to full you up and I felt watched that I didn't take too much by one of the inn keepers (May not have been intended). That made me felt uncomfortable. The serving sizes are small as if was a taste testing session. The happy hour was well attended and lots of booze. If thats your style you will love it. I would have preferred a heartier breakfast. Im not a smoker and this seems like a smokers den. Couldn't escape it - breakfast, pool hot tub and porch. Not used to it as we live in a smoke free city. If you are not a smoker there aren't any specially designed smoking areas so get ready. In summary a beautiful clean property. It will certainly do for your stay. A plus is the free internet cleanliness and the parking on site.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Ckayj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed over 4th of July weekend. The hotel location is great - an easy walk to Duval street and local attractions. We had no issues with noise. Check-in and check-out were hassle free and the employees were nice. Parking is $8 a night. I'd rather pay for parking than fight for a street spot, so it was money well spent. We skipped the free breakfast as the options were limited. We enjoyed the evening happy hour, though. The hotel itself feels rundown and tired - I know that's part of the being in Key West, but it's still not ideal. The room was reasonably clean, but not spectacular. The courtyard and pool area were small and crowded. I can't imagine coming here to lounge by the pool. For Key West, it's not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Its fine”
Reviews.Author: Adrie v
Reviews.Content: Almond Tree is indeed a quiet little Inn with lots of atmosphere. The garden & pool area is lovely and so is the room. The bathroom is small but it does the job. Check inn was fine, breakfast is ok. Nothing fancy but sufficient. A3

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: EXGO27
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree in is wonderful. From the moment we walked in through the gate after a quick and easy check-in to the very sad moment we had to drag our luggage back out that gate it was perfect. The pool is small and a little on the warm side, but quiet and calm and an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Duval. The coffee at breakfast is wonderful (my husband is a coffee snob) the pastries were fresh and varied. We would grab a bite and then go to Blue Heaven, Southernmost Cafe, or Sandy's and share a large breakfast. Made it economical. A great point is that CVS is right next door. It made it easy to grab snacks, extra beer, and swim noodles for the pool (which we bought and left there!) It was a great stay with an eager to please staff!! I highly recommend it and we will be back. . . someday soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the middle of Key West”
Reviews.Author: nlstults
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for one night when we came to Key West on the Key West Express ferry from Ft. Myers. The rooms were very nice and the service was exceptional. The staff went out of their way to be helpful to arrange taxis and a snorkeling trip, and made an exception to their policy of no late check out to accommodate a member of our party who needed the room to do a dialysis exchange. Even though check out was at noon, we were able to store our bags and use the pool at the Inn in the afternoon until it was time to check in for the ferry at 3 pm. We loved the complimentary appetizers and wine and the continental breakfast which was served outdoors in the lush patio area around the pool. The location was quiet yet just off Duval Street about 3 blocks from the Southernmost Point and 8 blocks from Mallory Square. The inn is located about 10 blocks from the ferry terminal so in the heat of the summer with luggage, a taxi is definitely recommended. We really enjoyed the two stop snorkel trip on one of the Fury catamarans-the boat staff were awesome. The Key West Express ferry was also a great way to get to Key West quickly without the hassle of driving. We really did not have time to see everything we wanted to so I would recommend staying at least 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Key West Inn”
Reviews.Author: porterw
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West to be married on the beach at sunset. We chose the Almond Tee Inn based on the location, and the reviews we read on-line. This is an outstanding inn, the service is excellent, the location is fantastic, the room was perfect, and the folks running this establishment could not have been nicer or more attentive to their guests. I highly recommend The Almond Tree Inn.... we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - Simply Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: justme2338
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at the Almond Tree In during the second week of June 2011. We chose this inn based solely on Trip Advisor reviews and were not dissapointed. The hotel grounds are beautiful and well kept and it's obvious that the owners and staff take pride in their property. Check in was smooth, the employees at the front desk offered assistance on activities on the island and provided us with a map to help get us started. The room was clean, lovely with plenty of fresh towels and great bath products. I will note that the bathroom is tiny as other reviewers have stated. If you're looking for a luxury resort with a full sized bathroom then this isn't your place. The Almond Tree Inn is really the perfect blend of a B&B and a hotel. Just enough involvement from the staff to make you feel welcome with just enough privacy like a large resort would offer. The pool and hot tub were never crowded or noisy and the evening happy hour with treats and wine is a nice touch. We had breakfast a couple of mornings at the Inn and it was a sufficient spread of pastries, coffee, juices and french toast slices. All with that personal touch and warm staff that The Almond Tree Inn offers. I would have liked to have a few more hooks or racks for drying towels in the room. We slung our towels outside the room to dry and they got wet from whoever watered the plants. I think the inn should also offer additional beach towels in a stack by the pools. Each lounge was set up with a towel but it would have been nice to have more than one towel. That's just a personal thing with me. After 7 nights at the Almond Tree Inn, my only complaint is that I wanted an extra beach towel or two - I'd say this place is a WINNER! I am very hard to please. Thanks to the Almond Tree Inn for a memorable lovely week in Key West and really thanks to all who've written reviews which I've come to rely on. Can't wait to go back to the Almond Tree Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “What a find! Great location, pleasant low-key atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: elsat
Reviews.Content: Guided by TripAdvisor recommendations, my husband and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for five nights at the end of March and were very pleased indeed. Our premium King room on the second floor was spacious, quiet and cool. It was well worth the cost of the upgrade over a standard room to have a desk and seating area, as the double room we saw was much smaller. Breakfast was plentiful and we appreciated the evening happy hour and refreshments (which varied from cheese and vegetable trays to Swedish meatballs to occasionally just chips, salsa and pretzels). The staff was uniformly excellent and made us feel welcome. The wireless internet worked fine in our room. The location was perfect for walking everywhere. Only downside was parking at $8/night, a bit costly.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Jan61666
Reviews.Content: Almond Tree was very easy to locate. Check in was easy with great service, we even had an upgraded room which was very clean and very spacious. (Rm #112) The enitre staff was very pleasant. It is in a great location, 3 blocks from the Southernmost Point and a pleasant walk to Mallory Square. Being 1/2 block off the busy Duval St. it was very quiet. We would certainly stay here again and recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Almond Tree”
Reviews.Author: NexyKaxy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn. It was a good value for the money. Location was perfect - One block away from Duval Street. The room was spacious with two queen sized beds and a pull out sofa.... perfect space for us girls. Continental breakfast was just okay, happy hour was really nice. And customer service was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Almond Tree Inn”
Reviews.Author: socntytiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and had a pleasant stay. The check in was easy and the service was prompt. The rooms were spacious and very clean. There where two ceiling fans and a great air conditioner. We had two queen beds, sofa, two armchairs, desk, fridge, microwave, and a safe. The location was great - three blocks from Southermost point and 30 feet from Duval street. It is a little less of a mile from Mallory Square but it is a pleasant walk with all the shops. The grounds were beautifully landscaped with a Koi pond and waterfall. The pool area was clean and inviting. There is only one con. The shower is small small small. We measured it and it is only 23 inches wide. When I stood in it to shower I had to stand sideways to raise my arms to wash my hair. This is not a big for us and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LODGINGS IN KEY WEST”
Reviews.Author: EMCEE44
Reviews.Content: My sister, my 12 year old son and I stayed here for two nights June 9-11. I relied heavily on the Trip Advisor reviews to select our Key West Lodgings. This place was perfect. The location is perfect - 1/2 block off Duval Street - close to the action, yet really quiet. The room was lovely (Room 115). The beds were really comfy and it was so helpful to have the fridge/sink/sitting area. The pool and hot tub were a welcome break after a long morning of touring. The continental breakfast was great. The coffee was fantastic. The happy hour in the afternoon with cheese/pepperoni was also perfect! All of the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. I really can't say enough about this Inn. The price was reasonable given the location. There was ample parking, which can be really hard to find in Key West. The parking was $8.00 per day which I thought was pretty reasonable. I would highly recommend this Inn for couples as well as families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Suz00
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Almond Tree for 3 nights in May and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is well located near Duval in the heart of Key West. The pool was very nice and my kids especially loved the koi pond. We had a large room, plenty of space for my husband and I as well as our 2 small kids who slept on air mattress on the floor. The hotel is family owned and operated and it was clear to us that they really care about thier guests. The continental breakfast and happy hour were also nice and made it feel more like a lovely bed and breakfast. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything about the Almont Tree Inn”
Reviews.Author: Tennessee_couple_11
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of Travel Advisor reviews we decided to stay at the Almond Tree Inn. We loved everything about our experience: The room was huge , tastefully decorated , a mini kitchen, glass walk-in shower, and sitting area. We stayed on the 2nd floor and would sit outside our room on the porch and enjoy (free) wine and cheese in the afternoon before we went out for the night. Breakfast was included: coffee, breads, fruit....very good and plenty for us. The staff is attentive but not intrusive. We would take a dip in the pool when we returned from our daily adventures. We are looking forward to another visit at the Almond Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but nice pool and location.”
Reviews.Author: bighassle
Reviews.Content: PROS: It's easy and convenient, the location can't be beat -- it's right in the middle of everything to do in Key West but also manages to feel tucked away and quiet. We were able to just park the car and walk everywhere. Nice pool area. We had a spacious room with mini-fridge/kitchenette. CONS: A young front desk staffer was rather rude to me when I asked for directions/recommendations. And while the room was fine, it was overpriced considering the decor and bathroom weren't exactly luxurious. Someone smeared pizza on our car in the parking lot. FINAL VERDICT: The Almond Tree is convenient and okay, it just doesn't have a lot of personality or charm.

Reviews.Title: “step right off Duval into a tropical oasis”
Reviews.Author: tikigirl13
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel with good reviews on tripadvisor but it completely exceeded my expectations. First of all, the people and service were amazing. Clean rooms, good size, good little kitchen and great outdoor areas. The location is great to walk anywhere, but in this little oasis, you would never know you were near Duval street. Perfect to walk anywhere, no car needed. Breakfast and happy hour were better than expected, and included!! I recommend looking for great restaurants off the beaten path, there are plenty in Key West. We are already planning our stay here for next year.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute BEST B&B in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Bella418
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent Memorial Day weekend in Key West to celebrate our 2 year anniversary. This was my second visit to the island and his first, so we wanted it to be as special as possible. After reading many reviews and doing hours of research online, my wonderful boyfriend came across the Almond Tree Inn and booked our room. This B&B is in the perfect location, with a 24 hour CVS right next door, a bike/scooter rental right across the street, and only 1/2 block off of Duval. It couldn't have been better. The room itself was great too, with surprisingly a very comfortable bed (for the few hours we spent sleeping), a nice sized mini-fridge, and microwave. The staff made us feel like we were at home and were extremely accommodating, especially Alex. Alex was very knowledgable about the area and treated us like his good friends. He deserves employee of the year! I have personally worked in the Hospitality Industry for over 5 years and good service is hard to find now a days. I would HIGHLY recommend the Almond Tree Inn to anyone and will definitely be staying here next time I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Surfcats
Reviews.Content: I found this gem while perusing Tripadvisor for places to stay on my third trip to Key West. The last two times I stayed at Ocean Key, but wanted something a bit smaller and more intimate. Lucky for me, I found Almond Tree. The front desk was especially helpful and welcoming. Shay, in particular, does it all. A gracious host for the evening happy hour, making recommendations on where to eat and giving advice on which tours to take. The grounds are lush and well maintained. The pool and jacuzzi are in fine shape with plenty of lounge chairs for the guests. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable with nice, soft sheets. The shower has plenty of power. There is a coffee maker in the room for those who don't want to venture out to the pool deck for the morning continental breakfast. The breakfast, by the way, has everything! Various juices, coffee, teas, french toast, bagels, muffins, yogurt, granola, cereals, etc. Awesome! The location is one block off the main drag, which is Duvall Street. An easy walk to everything, yet just enough off the beaten track so you can get some down time if that is what you want. All in all, this place should be, at a minimum, on your list of places to consider if you are contemplating a trip to Key West. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for location.”
Reviews.Author: 35Argyll
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute after a late decision to drive down to the Keys from Miami. We phoned a few of the hotels scoring well with Trip Advisor to see if there were any last minute deals, and the Almond Inn was the first to consider our request - even though the other hotels had plenty of vacancies for the couple of nights! The location, just off Duval street is excellent - there is a private parking lot, although you do have to pay an extra $8 a night for parking. Free drinks at Happy Hour, and a continental breakfast are also included. All the service from the staff was excellent - very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The only problem we had was that the upstairs neighbours were very noisy, and they could constantly be heard clanking around/talking/slamming drawers - late at night and early in the morning. All in all it was an affordable, friendly inn, well located, and had all the amenities that you require.

Reviews.Title: “We quickly realized we made the right choice staying here:)”
Reviews.Author: lilchick59
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the service and the friendly and very helpful staff, they wanted to make sure we had everything we needed , they went above and beyond to help us. It was also very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We started the day there with breakfast which was included (they had healthy choices ) . Location was excellent, we could walk everywhere. We will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Terry34957
Reviews.Content: Our visit was a special occasion and the staff at the Almond Tree Inn was very helpful in making our stay a memorable experience. I ordered a bottle of wine for my wife's birthday and this was provided complimentary. An unexpected touch. The atmosphere was great and location was close to the activities of the city, but not too close. This was a super trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & great location”
Reviews.Author: J9il13
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Almond Tree for a 4 night visit to Key West. The hotel is in a great location with a very short walk to Duval Street and great nightlife and easy to get around. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. The room was very clean and comfortable including the bathroom and shower. We used the pool a bunch which was awesome. And we used the free drink tickets you get at checkin for free cocktails and snacks between 5-7 every evening. The overall hotel was a great place to relax and a perfect base for exploring Key West. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Private oasis in the middle of Key West”
Reviews.Author: WIRobert
Reviews.Content: What a great place! We wished we had booked a longer stay than our two nights at the Almond Tree. The location is good- on Truman Ave. just off Duval St., close enough to all the action by just far enough away to be quiet and tranquil. The facility is tucked away on its own shady oasis. Grounds are lavishly landscaped with the pool and hot tub area the centerpiece. Breakfast and an afternoon happy hour are served in this space, which includes a covered gazebo. Some rooms face the pool and patio and each has a private porch. Others are located in a separate two-story building with wide shuttered balconies overlooking the pool. Our room was divided into two areas- one with two queen beds, the other with a sitting area and kitchenette. The bath was a bit small, especially the shower stall, but everything was very clean and in good condition. The owners were friendly and available. We parked our car just steps away from our room for the reasonable price of $8 per day. Just across Truman Ave. from the Inn is a place that rents bikes, scooters, and electric cars- all handy for getting around in Key West, where parking spaces for cars are in short supply. Within two blocks are two great places to eat- the Blackfin Bistro and the wonderful La Te Da.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: JPGINGER19
Reviews.Content: My Husband, Aunt, Uncle and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn April 4, 2011 for one night. It was our first visit to Key West and we could not have picked a better place to stay. We were right in the middle of everything without all the noise and crowds. The Inn itself was so clean and the beds were so comfortable that it was almost like being at home. Alex checked us in and was there the next morning for continental breakfast, which was wonderful. He was so nice and pleasant and was there if you needed anything. We would stay again on our next visit but next time we would stay longer and make sure to tell all our friends about this wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an Oasis”
Reviews.Author: GreenlandFan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for six consecutive nights earlier this month and were totally delighted. I must say that this property, which has only 22 rooms, is as close to perfect as any accommodation we have stayed anywhere in the world. Bill, the owner, is totally charming and helpful in every way. He obviously loves what he is doing and does it with great panache. His staff is also quite helpful. The property features a lovely swimming pool surrounded by lush tropical landscaping. The free happy hour was enjoyable and the free breakfasts were equally so. The Almond Tree Inn is truly an oasis in Key West--close enough to everything (the Hemingway house is just down and around the block) but far enough from the bustle to provide an extremely relaxing and welcoming stay. Recommendation: Don't miss the boat trip to the Dry Tortugas--beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bunnie100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights. Had a great time here. Continental breakfast was more than was expected and happy hour was very happy. Free glass or two of wine and apps between 5 and 7, worked out great to relax before dinner. All the staff from breakfast thru happy hour were wonderful. The pool was wonderful during the day, never seemed crowded. Please try it, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service, Location, and Tropicality Delivers Big Value in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Marco028
Reviews.Content: As twice-a-year vacationers to Key West, my wife and I have stayed at many different hotels on the island, including some of the big chains. But, having read the reviews I booked us four nights for late March, and the only regret I is that ended much too soon. As a relatively small hotel, guests are afforded the kind of personal service that can't possibly be delivered by the larger Hotels. Shay and Alex, were particularly attentive, knowing our names on Day 1. We normally skip breakfast except for one "Blue Heaven" day, but we made it a point to arise in the 9 o'clock hour each morning. We really liked the fact that the breakfast was available until 10, and we never felt rushed. The food, though limited, was of excellent quality, and just what we needed before we played tennis each morning, which brings us to the location. Twenty steps from Duval, a 6 minute bike ride to the Higgs Beach tennis courts, and a 1 minute walk to the drug store (we always forget to pack something), make the Almond Tree Inn the ideal location for us. Nestled on the center of the island southeast of disorder, I was expecting to hear some sleep-disturbing noise, but that didn't happen. The lush tropical grounds serve to quell the street noise and create an oasis of quiet easy island living- creating a yin to the yang of the Duval life we love, but in moderate doses. We made it a point to stay by the pool one afternoon, and we were both impressed by the staff's attention to detail. The sleep comfort was excellent, consistent with the reviews. The only small complaint was the bathroom was small and in need of remodeling- but this was easily overwhelmed by all that is right in the well-appointed room. The happy hours were enjoyable too- with good wine and conversation, as the staff serves you from a large kitchen window adjacent to both the pool and the front office, and there were always plenty of tables to accommodate. All told, the Almond Tree Inn exceeded our expectations, thanks in large part to the efforts of Shay and Alex. We told Shay as she alerted us that our taxi had arrived, "we will see you in November."

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Key West :)”
Reviews.Author: havebabytravelwell
Reviews.Content: Traveled to FL to visit parents in Bonita Springs, treated by parents to visit the Keys and travel together with my husband and 19 month old daughter. The Inn was very clean and the staff was very friendly and accomodating in helping with some nice restaurants. We found Mangoes at 700 Duval st. ourselves, but we wish we stayed to eat at may other eateries suggested , like the Roof top. The breakfasts were great and afternoon cocktail hr was a nice way to start the evening. I will visit this place again for sure and suggest to all of you also! The beds!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! super comfy!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DQUIN5340
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Almond Tree. Everything about this lovely hotel is perfect. From check in, which was quick and easy, the happy hour by the pool, to the breakfast, ( have the french toast). Close to everything you want to see. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: frefresia
Reviews.Content: I had fun at this place, basically well centered. The only bad thing is that I could hear out top neighbours having sex all night!!! But other then that it was clean and fun because they'll give breakfast.. Parking you pay!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: along0111
Reviews.Content: Another winner picked thanks to TA reviews! The location EXCELLENT, 1/2 a block from Duvall Street. When you walk behind the gates, it's as if you stepped out of the hustle and partying of Key West in to a oasis!! The room was basic, bed super comfortable (better then my new bed at home!), with a fridge, coffee maker, super clean! Hot tub and pool area perfect! Beautiful landscaping! My husband and I stayed for 2 days in Key West, our home base Key Largo for this trip. We never wanted to leave. I'm sure the price keeps this from being a "spring-breakers" place. The "Happy Hour" was a nice touch, and though stated 2 drinks per each guest, we weren't limited, but didn't take advantage, either. Breakfast was basic continental, but a great way to start the day on your tiny patio with a cup of coffee, orange juice, mimosa, fruit, eggs, bagels, in the beautiful Key West weather. My friends that traveled with us stayed at the Days Inn, and didn't hide their jealousy when they saw our accomadations! It seemed most people went to bed early, and my husband and I enjoyed a romantic time in the hot tub and pool in the evening. It was like our own place! The only negative I can say is we didn't stay long enough!

Reviews.Title: “charming abd friendly”
Reviews.Author: Schuyler_11
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay...very friendly staff, quaint inn, a little old but very clean. You can walk everywhere in the Duval St. area of Key West. It is also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Friendly Staff, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: VancouverLL
Reviews.Content: We took an overnight trip to Key West from Miami (long drive, by the way) and stayed overnight at the Almond Tree Inn. The room was spacious, clean and the staff always friendly. They serve a great continental breakfast each morning which is far more substantial than you might typically find elsewhere. The hotel is within a very short stroll to anything you might want (or care) to see in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great location.”
Reviews.Author: vettegirl95
Reviews.Content: If you want to be steps from "Old Town" Key West this is the hotel to stay at. The room was very clean and comfortable. The pool was nice. They had a nice continental breakfast each morning and happy hour in the early evening. That definitely added to the value of this hotel. My only complaint is the noise from the traffic-but that comes with the location of the hotel; ear plugs will solve that problem. The hotel staff was on top of everything and always ready to help out. In fact we arrived quite early the day of check in and they really went out of their way to get us into our room early. That was A1 in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: straveler57
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Almond Tree and were very pleased with everything about this quaint hotel. The rooms were very clean, the staff extremely accommodating and helpful and the location was excellent. It was nice to be within walking distance of Duvall and all the entertainment, yet far enough away to be quiet and peaceful when you need a break. The afternoon happy hours were excellent and the morning breakfast very convenient. This location is also convenient to bike rentals, laundromat, CVS and restaurants all on the same block. We would definitely stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: hivanessa28
Reviews.Content: My FAVORITE hotel! It was a sweet surprise to find this hotel; thank you Trip Advisor. It is a smaller, more charming hotel close enough to Duval St, yet quiet. The hotel is surrounded by palm trees, there is a small clean pool and hot tub. They serve a fun afternoon reception of wine or beer. Very friendly, helpful staff.
