BUT the best part was our WONDERFUL room! So fresh smelling, extremely clean, and HUGE soft beds! We stayed in room 114 and we very, very happy. Breakfast was nice by the pool; great coffee and oj with all kinds of baked treats. We actually wanted to stay another night; but the hotel was full. We know why. I thought it was an expensive hotel when we booked it; now I understand its actually quite reasonable. This will always be my first choice for any trips to Key West. Hope this helps decide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: waltsailor
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay here and once again it was the perfect getaway from the cold north. The hotel is centrally located, close enough to the action on Duval St. but far enough away to not have the noise. The best thing about the Almond Tree is the staff, always helpful, friendly and willing to give local advice on places to see. The hotel is immaculately clean and the pool in the center of a tropical garden is a great place to hang out. Free continental breakfast and Happy Hour bring the guests all together and makes it seem like you're home with family. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: mjj056
Reviews.Content: although the non - suite rooms were rather small, they were very clean. beds were comfortable. we stayed 3 nights and I wouldn`t hesitate to stay there on our next visit!! the pool was very clean, as was the area around the pool. each guest receives 2 tickets each for happy hour there at the almond tree. choices include beer, wine, soft drinks. they also lay out a nice cheese & crackers spread. location is just steps from duval st. it`s not a noisy section of duval. nice breakfast restaurant around the block called camille`s. check it out. great food,reasonable prices!! good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location...Wonderful Inn”
Reviews.Author: MidwestLiketoTravel
Reviews.Content: Almond Tree Inn is a delightful spot that was more than we expected it to be. The innkeepers are very attentive and pleasant. The grounds were immaculate and it was obvious they took pride in the property. The breakfast and evening social hour were especially nice. Room was ample sized (even though bathroom was not). Pool and hot tub were nice, and temperatures of both were perfect. Waterfalls were a pleasant touch, and also served to eliminate the city noise. Almond Tree is in a perfect location at Truman near Duval, making almost everything downtown walkable. This was our first trip to Key West, and when we return, we would definitely stay at Almond Tree Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanarioViajero
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree Inn is in a good location, close to "downtown" Key West. Therefore, you can just walk to the major sights, which will take you just a couple of minutes. The service at the front desk is not the best we have had. However, this was made up with the happy hour which was held every late afternoon, with free snacks and free drinks (including beer!). Breakfast is very simple and basic, with no warm dishes whatsoever. The rooms are nicely furnished, and are big in size. So...nothing to complain about them. There is a nice pool and a jacuzzi, which is a good place to relax after walking around Key West. Another thing to take in mind is that internet is not free. Therefore, in order to get our boarding cards, we had to the guy at the front desk all the details of our frequent flyer account in order to get them (as he did not allow us to do it ourselves at the computer). Why isn't there a computer with free internet access for all the guests? Finally, you have to pay to park in the hotels parking lot, which at the end is a must, since you have to pay in order to park on the street. I strongly suggest the managers of the Almond Tree Inn to include the parking fee in the room rate, as it is something that bothers guests to pay to park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and setting”
Reviews.Author: relwyn
Reviews.Content: We had a suite room which was a good size with a nice sitting area and very nice furniture. TV was a bit old but you don't go to Key West to watch TV. Hotel is very convenient - half a block off lower Duval St. Fairly quiet neighborhood but can walk to anything on Duval. Hotel pool area was beautifully landscaped and private. Nice happy hour with two free drinks per day. They pour a FULL glass of wine. Service was excellent. A few small issues keep it from being a five star. No light in the bathroom over the toilet, no utensils, plates or bottle opener in the small kitchen area. There was a small refrigerator. No towel racks near the sink. Thin walls mean you can hear the neighbors when you are trying to sleep, however the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Footnotes1
Reviews.Content: I really cannot add much to what has already been written. Believe it all. The location is quiet and outstanding. The host and hostess were outstanding in every way. They were more than eager to please. One tip is to request rooms 101-103 if you want to receive the WIFI while in your room. Otherwise you need to set outside, under roof, near the office.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: maccool10
Reviews.Content: Very clean nice comfy beds great pool and hot tub. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right"”
Reviews.Author: kurtisq13
Reviews.Content: Very clean!! This Inn has everything you need and if they don't have it they will get it for you. All the rooms are centered around a courtyard/pool area, which is where free continental breakfast and happy hour are everyday. If you are looking for a clean and quiet place to stay that isn't next to 'Cowboy Bills' this is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Key Weat”
Reviews.Author: Anita614
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Almond Tree Inn January, 2010 and February 2011. Such a wonderful place to stay. It is covenient, breakfast and happy hour are well supplied. The bathrooms are a bit too small and the internet signal was weak so laptops were brought into the courtyard to use. We enjoyed enjoyed the location, the amenities and the hospitality provided by Shea and staff. We were surprised that the owners charge $8.00 per night per parking space considering the cost of the rooms but realize that parking is a premium on Key West. We do love this place and would definitely return a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveKW2011
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for three nights in January while I was down planning my wedding which is this coming July. The resort where I am getting married has very overpriced rooms so I was looking for alternatives for my guests. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here so much that the majority of our family and wedding party will be staying here next summer in lieu of the 4 star resorts on the island. The staff is phenomenal and we just loved the happy hour and the continental breakfast. Most hotels/guest houses shy away from working with groups, but not the Almond Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: Nikita50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for 3 nights in January. And I agree with all the reviews. The location is very convenient, the property is lovely and clean, and the continental breakfast is all you need. And yes, the bathroom is small, but we spent very little time in the room so it wasn't an issue. I only wish our room had a window that could be opened (some of the other rooms do). But we worked around that and propped open the door periodcally. Money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay at a hotel that treats you like family and not just hotel guest, then this is your place.”
Reviews.Author: Baccala12000
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at a hotel that treats you like family and not just hotel guest, then this is your place. Funny how we( Wife/myself) never met or spoke to anyone from the hotel, but the moment we walked in (4 hours early to check-in) we felt special and appreciated for our patronage. They (Shea and Alex) provided us safe storage for of our luggage (since our room was still occupied till 12:00 check out) and generously offered us assistance in securing dinner reservations. Our room once ready, was clean, spacious and tastefully decorated. The bed was perfect offering the correct balance of firmness and comfort. The continental breakfast offered each morning is merely footsteps away. We were courteously greeted each morning by Alex who provided us with coffee, juice and a nice assortment of fresh fruit, bagels and baked goods. The happy hour that is provided each day from 5 to 7 offers an array of vegetables, cheeses, sodas, house wines and cold domestic beers. The adult beverage require a ticket (2 tickets per person provide for each day of stay) due to some people (chuckleheads) in the past abusing the open bar policy. The hotel is centrally located in (the quiet section) just off Duval Street and within walking distance of landmarks, eateries and famous watering holes. As they did at our arrival, they graciously stored our bags as we had a late flight and tried to squeeze every minute of vacation. The Almond Tree Inn and itâ€™s Staff (Shea and Alex) made this vacation stay special. We will definitely be back on our next trip back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: laward11
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from a trip to Key West and we had a fabulous experience at The Almond Inn. We had great service and the owners were delightful. It was in a perfect location - corner of Duval street but on the quieter end so you could get away from the crowds. The rooms were comfortable and well decorated and it was nice to have the complimentary continental breakfast and happy hour each day. A very special touch was that each room received a bottle of champagne and other goodies on New Year's Eve. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice staff. Bathroom was tiny but clean.”
Reviews.Author: ejfudd
Reviews.Content: Nice place, nice staff. Bathroom was tiny but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cute inn, close to the action but quiet”
Reviews.Author: dpo916
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late december, just for 1 night. Its easy to find, easy to check in. Happy hour is a nice gesture even though there are limited beverage options (beer and wine). We walked everywhere including to duval, Mallory square, southernmost point, lighthouse, hemingway home, etc. Rooms at the inn are cute and spacious with a small little patio. The grounds are nice with pool, jacuzzi, koi pond. My only complaint is that shower had terrible water pressure. Breakfast in the morning was also great. Would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous little paradise jewel, perfect location,GREAT Staff,what a find!!”
Reviews.Author: nonijohn
Reviews.Content: After having visited Key West numerous times, I always felt a little cheated and disappointed when it came to accommodations, either location was bad or room and value were terrible. Not so on this trip. The Almond Tree was terrific. The staff was 5 stars, location was the best we've ever had. Breakfast and happy hour were great! We were upgraded to a suite. Pool was perfect. Room was ALWAYS cleaned when we came back to it. Parking ONLY 8 dollars a day...WOW. We can't say enough. Thanks Shea and Alex. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of Key West”
Reviews.Author: jonh53
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff - nothing was too much trouble. The room was very well decorated and the bed was not only big but very very comfortable. If I return to Key West this will be my first choice .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Chelle-n-Andy
Reviews.Content: When my boyfriend and I first arrived, I was skeptical. I'm used to staying in Hilton Hotels and this by no means was a commercial chain hotel. We checked in with Alex who made us feel more than welcome with his above and beyond customer service. The pool and jacuzzi were small and a little shaded by a lot of palm trees, but the atmosphere was relaxing and quite beautiful. We enjoyed self-made margaritas outside until it was time for happy hour. The hotel offers complimentary happy hour from 5-7pm. It's a good deal to get your night started. They offer a variety of snacks such as cheese, pepperoni, crackers, chips, etc. and free drink coupons (2 per person per night). They also offer great deals (1/2 off already low prices) once you run out of coupons. The location is practically on the corner of Duval Street where all the action is and in a central location. We were close to both beaches (Fort Taylor which you pay to get in unless you have a military ID and Southernmost which you only pay if you want a chair). We would recommend exploring both of them as they each have their own advantages. We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for a total of 3 nights. The bed was VERY comfortable and again staff made all the difference, especially Alex. Breakfast was nice to have each morning- bagels, pastries, hard boiled eggs, and an array of fruit. Also, coffee and juice to drink. Rooms were a little dated and shower was small, but everything worked perfectly and it quickly became our little home in Key West :) When we return to Key West, we will definitely stay here again. Thanks for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “One worker can make the difference-- in a bad way!”
Reviews.Author: steancum
Reviews.Content: Based on the TA reviews, I wanted to give a try to Almond Tree while visiting Key West with my family, but the worker at the front desk completely discouraged me from doing so. I wanted to use a $10 discount coupon offered at trip advisor for the hotel, but, since I was on the road, I didn't have the means to print it and couldn't present it when checking in. I asked the young man in the front desk to help me out and he refused to print the coupon for me. I know I was suppose to bring the coupon with me when checking in, but we had not plan to visit Key West and when we decided to do it, I didn't have access to a printer. I agree that the $10 saving was not a big deal, but not been willing to help, not even being willing to say "sorry I can't help you" was a truly shortcoming on customer service. Any way, I cannot rate the hotel on anything since i didn't really stayed there, but a business that fails to help a potential customer, especially in something as simple as printing a coupon, don't deserves my business or anybody else's business for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Never have to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: EYWfan4life
Reviews.Content: I had traveled to Key West for the first time this past April, my boyfriend had been there before and said that we had to go. I found the Almond Tree online while hotel hunting and all of the positive reviews def made me a bit curious to check this spot out. This place is absolutley amazing! We arrived almost 3 hours before check-in and our room was ready! They let us check in early and right from the very start of our stay the were extremly polite, professional, and accomadating. The grounds of the 22 room B&B style hotel is like a little island tucked away 1 block from Duval. Lush greens, flowers of everycolor, little lizards running everywhere, and a beutiful koi pond with a tranquil water fall all greet you on the walk to your room. By the pool are nice longe chairs to "sleep it off" by the pool if you so choose and always have a soft towel waiting for you. The room itself is a little small, but it is all about the quality here! The room is clean, well kept, very comfortable. The bath ammentities are Bath and Body works. The bed we slept in was incredible! it was almost too big! They even changed the mattresses mid-week to Serta ultimate sleepers, so we got an even BIGGER, more plush bed. Happy hour and the continental breakfast offered daily to guests are just the icing on the already delcious cake :) Even my boyfriend said that he will never stay in another hotel in KW. This is our place!

Reviews.Title: “This place made us feel special...”
Reviews.Author: Flowers4Algernon
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree Inn is such a beautiful place. The rooms are elegant and so clean. They have a continental breakfast and a complimentary happy hour and we were treated like royalty. This was our first trip to Key West. I was with my teenage granddaughter and was so glad I made reservations at the Almond Tree. We felt like we were in another world and felt so safe. The staff is so friendly and we felt so welcome. I will definitely stay there again when I return to Key West. and I can hardly wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: 2bloomys
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden gem. The room was a bit small but very clean and very comfortable. Very friendly on site owner as is all the staff. Beautiful small courtyard with lush trees, pool, hot tub, and Koi pond. So intimate. So quiet. Nice continental breakfast and a happy hour with free beer & wine plus snacks. I would stay there again or anywhere if it was owned by "Bill".

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCJF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn two nights at the beginning of Fantasy Fest (Friday & Saturday nights). We came on the Key West Express ferry from Fort Myers. The bicycle taxi from the ferry to the hotel cost between $20-25 -- other than this we walked everywhere. The hotel room that we had was excellent -- everything was very modern and in great shape and the room was clean. The bed and bedding is exceptional. The service at the hotel is wonderful. We enjoyed the happy hour both days as well as the continental breakfast. The hotel is just off Duval Street at Truman but it is quiet. The only thing about the hotel that was a bit negative for us was the location because you definitely need to take a hearty walk to get to the main action on Duval Street. We've been to Key West twice before and stayed at the Hilton/Weston, which is close to the start of Duval. The heat definitely takes it's toll on your energy level and your interest in walking to get to the area where you want to be -- and once you return to the hotel you are not too interested in walking all the way back later in the day. Overall our stay at the Almond Tree Inn was great and we would highly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accomodations, Spectacular Staff , Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jptreacy
Reviews.Content: This place is spectacular! Bill & his well trained staff truly made us feel like guests! Great continental breakfast and evening beer & wine cocktail hour. We stayed in room 109 a King size bed with a mattress which was heaven sent! I mean , I loved it so much, I emailed the owner so I can buy one like it for my home! The grounds of the Inn are well kept with a beautiful courtyard & relaxing swimming pool! There is free wifi too! The location is corner of Truman & Duval street, lots of wonderful restaraunts & Pubs to walk to. We stayed 2 nites Oct 15-17th & left the car in the parking lot the entire weekend! The staff was extremely friendly & the rooms were kept extremely clean! We hated to leave. We can't wait to return for another fabulous stay !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the keys!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSkittles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! It is comfy, the grounds are serene, the staff cares, the location is good, and they have free breakfast AND happy hour. I was nervous about whether the rooms would be nice enough - they definitely are. We weren't in the room tons, but they are clean, fairly up to date, and well kept. The grounds have a pool, hot tub, water fall, and coy fish pond - all lovely. Seriously, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Paradise with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: crittersfl
Reviews.Content: My wif and I just spent two nights here at the Almond Tree Inn. I chose this Inn based on the reviews and its location, we have always stayed at the larger chains-untill now. Wow this place is great, the service was tops the people exceptionally friendly and helpful and the room was the cleanest we have ever found. My wife is fanatical about cleanliness and this passed her muster, we had a King suite and it was plenty large enough for the two of us. While the pool is small it is enclosed by a lush patio with plenty of seating for all. The Inn was always keeping the place clean and the landscaping trimmed. The complementary happy 2 hours from 5-7 each night was very special and above what I have found with the larger resorts. They served free beer and wine with all the sncks you could ask for, there was no limit and I did not see this being abused either. While we did not have a pet we did see guests with theirs and it was not a problem. There is a private outdoor parking lot and the location of the Inn is great to walk and see everything in Key West. Mallory Square is about a 1/2 hour walk if you do not stop in the stores, the Hemingway house is about 3 minutes and the Southernmost point is about 10 minutes walking. You are right off Duval street on the quieter end which is really convienent, the Conch Train just started a new stop right on the corner next to the Inn. That is perfect, don't worry there is no noise or crowds because of it. The Inn does not have a restaurant but does serve a great continental breakfast of bagels, toast, bolied eggs,muffins and all kinds of pastrys. You feel safe and cozy here -We will definately stay here when in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: tiptoe2
Reviews.Content: great service very helpful real nice place very very clean great location tip top cannot praise enough thanks to all the staff do not hesitate in booking the almond tree you wont find better parking spaces at extra cost well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: 5StarBohemian
Reviews.Content: I can understand why people are raving about this little hotel. The location is perfect and the staff is nice. The hotel is cute and the rooms are clean. But it's not quite amazing or perfect. 1) the sheets are like sandpaper. 2) the room is quite bright at night and there is nothing one can do about it 4) during the day one has the opposite problem, not enough sunlight 3) the tv is outdated and makes a humming sound [this is not a big deal, cause you're not there to watch the tube, but if you're going to call it perfect..] I still would highly recommend this hotel. I don't think Key West is worth a second trip, but we don't regret our stay at the Almond Inn.

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: susieq1319
Reviews.Content: MY boyfriend and i were so pleased at this resort i would tell the world about it ...clean ,happy hour is the best close to everything and i mean everything would i return to the almond tree resort you BET i would!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay anywhere else in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: jeagerman
Reviews.Content: My g/f and i were there from 10-4-10 - 10-7-10. From the time i talked with Jose on the phone and made the resv. till the time i checked out i was never more impressed with a property! We stayed in an upstairs King Suite and it felt better then Home. We loved it all, from the room, staff, lil breakfeast in the am and the Beer and Wine at night all included. The Worst part about staying there is having to leave. Do yourself a favor and stay at this place you will Love it!! Thank you Almond tree for a great lil get-a-way that we needed! We will be back Soon!

Reviews.Title: “could not have wished for anything better”
Reviews.Author: barrymcavoy419
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 night and it was fantastic. The room was spotless and the staff were the nicest people you could get. Just round the corner from duvall st and a stones throw from every thing you could need. Wouldbe recomend this hotel to any one who is going to key west. my thanks to the hotel and all there staff for a brilliant stay . Two thumbs up to them all, made my holiday perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cskr16
Reviews.Content: This is a truly amazing inn. It is in a great location in Key West yet it seems so far from it all. The staff is fantastic, friendly and always willing to go the extra mile. The rooms are clean and comfortable. It has a beautiful pool and great nightly happy hour. I would absolutely stay at this inn again when I travel to Key West. LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket to enjoy Key West; a small oasis in a fun town.”
Reviews.Author: mtbski
Reviews.Content: Located on a busy side street near a supermarket and other commercial businesses, the Almond Tree is a hidden treasure behind beautiful landscaping. Once you enter the property gates you are in a quiet haven of flower- filled courtyard, fountains and pool. The large, clean rooms surround the gardens. Breakfast and happy hour (with generous appetizers) are included in the reasonable room rate. These are served buffet style amid the fountains and are a nice time to meet other guests or visit with the friendly staff. Centrally located, it is an easy walk to Fort Zachary Taylor State Park, the spectacular Butterfly Conservatory or Southernmost Beach. A trolley or a little longer walk lets you enjoy Truman annex or Mallory Square and the sunset festival.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the most amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Paige1267
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been here 6 - 7 times and will continue to come back. The rooms, the staff, the atmosphere are all top of the line. I agree with one of the other comments that said that you almost hate to reveal this place as it is one of our "little secrets" but for the location, price, service and atmosphere it is one of the best place ever.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for a vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: eeeeyo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn just last week and found it to be an excellent choice. The rooms were a nice size and very clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and helpfull, and the price was very reasonable. All in all, an excellent value. It was very relaxing to spend time laying by the pool and swimming in a very quaint garden type setting. The complimentary continental breakfast was excellent and the happy hour was very nice. The location to Duval Street was very handy, since we didn't need to drive anywhere during our entire visit. I highly recommend tis to anyone looking for a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bill and his staff - at least I believe...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bill and his staff - at least I believe Bill is owner/mngr... AMAZING I almost do not want to write this review because I'm afraid it won't be our secret spot anymore! But they deserve high ratings. If you like a cozy friendly spot ...this is it...the rooms are exactly that a cozy clean...smell fresh room with the most comfortable bed... The pool is literally steps outside your door and the waterfall is so inviting. I'll be honest the shower is a little tight but certain things I can overlook for friendly comfy and clean. My husband and I had been there once before and we will definitely be returning! Kudos Almond Tree Inn.... Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “As good as any 4 star hotel! Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: pssprinkle
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of the Almond Tree Inn I decided to book our anniversary stay here. My husband and I were definately not disappointed! The rooms are as nice as any 4 star hotel I have stayed in. Room was very clean and smelled great. The bedding is very high quality and beds are very comfortable. I really liked that the floors are ceramic tile and not carpet. Much cleaner in such a high humidity area. Each room has it's own furnished patio or balcony. The staff was fantastic and very accomidating to any request. The happy hour is great with beer, wine and snacks. The location is perfect. Right off Duval and within walking distance to Malory Square and the Southern Most Point. We were having such a great time, we extended out stay to 3 nights instead of our planned 2. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey779
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking our trip to Key West, and we finally decided to stay at the Almond Tree Inn based on the great reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites. We were not disappointed. The location, staff, rooms - everything - was great! I loved the fact that we could walk everywhere we wanted, but still be on the quiet side of Duval Street. The breakfast and complimentary happy hour were added bonuses. The next time we go to Key West I won't waste any time deciding where to stay - we'll book the Almond Tree for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel with very friendly staff, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Beachseeker6
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Almond Tree Inn and were pleasantly surprised. It is a small hotel one block from the quietier end of Duval Street. The room was beautifully decorated, bathroom clean and modern. Very pretty grounds. Parking on site for $7.00, which is essential in Key West. There is a happy hour with free beer, wine and snacks in the afternoon and free continental breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No choice other than the Almond Tree for us!”
Reviews.Author: DarlaT
Reviews.Content: Well, just returned from our fourth trip to the Almond Tree Inn in Key West and left feeling like we were leaving home. Again,, it exceeded our expectations. First, the location. So walkable to Duval Street and Mallory Square. It is surrounded by so many trees and vegetation and with the background noise of the waterfall into the pool, the pond and the hot tub it totally drowns out any background noise. There is a CVS exactly next door and not only do you not see it, you hear nothing from the store. There is a great continental breakfast and a lovely happy hour from 5-7. It's a great opportunity to talk with other patrons from around the globe. EVERYONE is soooo friendly and I can't say enough about the desk staff, maintenance and housekeeping. The rooms are lovely and the most important factor I look for when we travel in cleanliness. The rooms are always, always, IMMACULATELY CLEAN. Bill the owner runs a very tight shift and has very high expectations for his staff. We checked out after two nights and started our journey back up to Naples area and blew a tire; the long and short of i,t ended back in Key West at Sears for a new tire. Called Shea from along our route and she cheerfully found us another room in the hotel, poolside, queen suite. Even nicer than the king we were in for the two nights. When we travel to Key West, there is no other option for us other than the Almond Tree Inn. Thanks to all of you for helping us have a quiet, relaxing, pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Suntime5
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for two nights with my husband and we wish it could have been longer. You truly feel like you are at an inn. The staff is there to help you with anything you need. The happy hour is excellent with a good selection of wine, beer, soda, and munchies. The breakfast is equally good. There is a very good variety. I cannot say enough though about the wonderful staff. They were friendly and attended to every detail. The pool is clean and the landscaping around it makes you feel like you are on your own little tropical island. The location is perfect and it is an easy walk to anywhere you want to go. Although we did take a taxi once because it was so hot. Bruce at the front desk called for us and it was there in minutes. The rooms are decorated beautifully. There is only a standup shower but that didn't bother us. It can get a little noisy at night if people are out talking by the pool so try to get a room furthest from the pool. We loved Key West and the Almond Tree!

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: expat_expl0rer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just off of the quiet end of Duval Street. Very modern and pleasant throughout with good air conditioning. Some nice touches, 2 hour happy hour complimentary drinks are served every evening which is a good opportunity to catch up with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect short trip”
Reviews.Author: kativosk
Reviews.Content: If ever you need to get away for just 3 or 4 days, Key West is the ideal location. The Almond Tree Inn is a great place. It is a small property just off Duval St. and a short walk to the center of the action. Bill, the owner, is a "hands-on" manager, and he has chosen his employees well--they could give lessons on customer service. They offer a small but adequate breakfast, and the evening cocktail hour is a great start to the evening. We had the opportunity to meet and become friends with a number of fellow guests. I have stayed at a lot of large hotels and resorts, and they have their place, but as hard as they try they are not as personable as a well-run small hotel or B & B.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: kss1226
Reviews.Content: After reading ALL and EVERY review on B&B's in Key West, I chose the Almond Tree. I have always stayed at my favorite "Ocean Key Resort" on my trips to Key West, but money was tight this year and decided to try something different and less expensive. I was surprisingly delighted to see how fabulous and incredibly clean our room was. We stayed in an upgraded room on ground level, which was actually a beautiful suite right in front of the pool. The rooms are remodeled and the bathroom, linens and furniture were incredibly more beautiful then I ever imagined. This was my first time at a B&B and for experiencing such an intimate and peaceful atmosphere and I truly enjoyed it. There's a nice happy hour for two hours every night and the free breakfast buffet of bagels and danish was very nice as well. The pool is open 24 hours and all they ask is that you keep the noise down, which is only fair to the other guests. The location is quite a walk from the Sloppy Joe's side of town, and it's centrally located and one block from Duval St.. There is a 24 hour CVS and Denny's within a block of the hotel and I liked that. All in all... as long as the service, quality and price remain the same, I will def stay at the Almond Tree again. Can't wait to go back again! P.S. Ask to stay in a room closest to the pool. It may be noisier if there happens to be loud guests, but it's much more beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “It Took Me Ten Trips to Key West to Find the Best Hotel/B&B”
Reviews.Author: ohfortuna2010
Reviews.Content: We have visited Key West once a year for the last ten years. We have stayed at Duval House twice - La Concha once - Key Lime Twice - Marrero Guest Mansion once - a few less memorable properities complete the list. WOW - we will never stay any place else. Its elegant yet simple - quiet yet close - the room was beautiful - well appointed and cold when we needed a chill the most. Check-in was painless - happy hour was well stocked and generous. Make this your home base - you won't regret it! Only Cons: They need to upgrade to flatscreens and make wireless available in each room. Steven & Moe

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: SallyΦl
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and wished we were staying for longer! Beautiful room - excellent decor - spotlessly clean - comfortable bed. We could not find anything to fault! Happy hour drinks and snacks were very welcome and Alex was friendly and helpful - we hope he makes his trip to NYC!! Location was perfect.The Almond Tree is a peaceful oasis to rest and relax after a busy day exploring Key West. We'll definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place.”
Reviews.Author: Chillum
Reviews.Content: Nice little place in the middle of it all but off the beaten path just enough. Very comfortable beds. Great snacks and breakfast. Right off the quiet end of Duval St. Nice off street parking.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay..I hope to stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: MrsJudy
Reviews.Content: This is one great place..very clean and well-decorated...bed was so comfy..nice, fresh breakfast and happy hour was wonderful with free wine and beer. staff was very friendly and there to help. great location near it all..you well not be disappointed..very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: why_rush
Reviews.Content: Two couples in our party made a spur of the moment trip to Key West and booked rooms at the Almond Tree based on a neignbor's recommendation. One of the most pleasant lodging experiences we've had in many years of traveling. Shady courtyard/pool and tastefully appointed room with super efficent air conditioning were welcome respites from 95 degree heat. Staff bent over backwards to insure our comfort. Met several guests who were "regulars" and have returned numerous times. If you don't enjoy your stay here you're likely an incorrigible grouch and probably should just stay at home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place, central to everything but at a great price, great service, great mattress.”
Reviews.Author: Shallowminded1
Reviews.Content: Nice little place. Staff aims to please. Close enough to walk to most anywhere people come to Old Town for and the price was reasonable. Loved the happy hour. Loved the mattress ("Certa Presidential" they said). Would return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Almond Tree”
Reviews.Author: Elver_8
Reviews.Content: It was our second trip to Key West. We found this hotel via trip adviser and I must say this was a great choise. We feld in love the minute we arrived. The hotel exteroir looked very nice, landscape was great. Our room (105) was wel equiped and located in front of the pool. The pool was clean and inviting. The staff were always friendly and helpful especially Alex. Every evening between 5-7 was a happy hour which was free alcohol and nibbles, we obviously enjoyed this every night. It was a perfect location to sit and chill out after your day out, and offered a perfect start to all of our evenings out. The location of the Almond tree is central and within a walking distance to all highlights of Key West. If we ever return to Key West we will absolutely stay again at the Almond tree.

Reviews.Title: “5th time back - and just as good!”
Reviews.Author: Pete2306
Reviews.Content: We have been fortunate to visit Key West 5 times from the UK, each time staying at the Almond Tree. That probably says enough in itself, but the reasons we stay there are key to our revisits. First , the rooms. Not the largest you will find - but why would you want to spend time in your room in Key West? They are tastefully decorated, comfortable, and easy to live with. OK - the aircon unit under the window can be a little annoying, and in a room next to the pool you have to rely on the other guests being respectful at night if they use the it - but neither of these would make us stay anywhere else. And the location is perfect! It takes about 15 mins to walk to Mallory Square, and 10 mins to the Southernmost Point - with Art shops, kitsch gift shops, fantastic bars and eateries on the way....

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a minute”
Reviews.Author: donna223
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in May at the Almond Tree Inn and would go back in a minute! Centrally located, excellent service, very friendly staff and clean rooms make this an ideal place to stay. We enjoyed 2 very relaxing days and nights in Key West and would not have stayed anywhere else. Thank you to Bill and all his staff!

Reviews.Title: “Almost”
Reviews.Author: WITravelista27
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree Inn is a very attractive spot. Well located on Truman near the corner with Duval. It has ample parking at $7 a night (we were under the impression it was free when we signed on). Even the parking lot is attractive! Enter a gate into a lovely outdoor sitting area with tables, chairs and an abundance of overhead fans. Cool and pleasant, with a view of the pool and most of the rooms. Part of the "L" shaped property is two story and the other near the gate and office is one story. We stayed in a king bedded room near the office. The rooms are a bit small, but cleverly set up and with all the amenities--ironing board, iron, hair dryer, etc. Our problems there were two-fold. First problem was that the place was packed with loud drunken folk who monopolized the pool and environs all afternoon, who were VERY profane. We aren't prudes, but this was just over the top! Some of these same folks had a two hour confab outside our room at 3 am and basically kept us awake until after 5 am. No management is around overnight, so we really had no recourse. (We learned later that we could have walked to the office and called a number posted there and someone would have been there 15 minutes later.) The second difficulty was the cleverly set up AND spotless rooms presented some functional problems. There was only one chair in the room. The very comfortable and pretty bed was way too close to the air conditioner. Essentially, the air blew two feet and then onto the person sleeping on that side. Me! In the end, we had to turn off the air, which was great until the room got too warm. I don't think I would stay there again for the above-stated reasons. Maybe someone younger who enjoys a few drinks would have a better appreciation for the clientele, and would be able to sleep with the air conditioner. I don't like being critical because it is a charming property, the personnel were helpful and pleasant. There is a continental breakfast that we by-passed for a full fledged meal elsewhere. I am checking off that I would recommend this place to a friend, but only with a few caveats.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made me feel like a houseguest!”
Reviews.Author: gypsytoes
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West to get married on the beach end of April 2010. We had stayed at the Almond Tree Inn 2 years ago and couldn't wait to return. Can't say enough great things about this place, rooms, breakfast, happy hour, pool and hot tub....all fantastic. Bill and the staff are wonderful and will bend over backwards to help you out. We found a big box of chocolates and a lovely card in our room when we returned from our wedding......very thoughtful. We will certainly return because although Key West is an uber fun place to vacation, the Almond Tree is just a great place to hang your hat for a week!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small informal hotel - a great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: w0rldwidetravelleruk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Almond Tree Inn based upon a recommendation from friends, and we were not dissapointed. If you are looking for a very nice relaxed and laid back place to chill out then this is the place. It's close (basically on, almost at one end) of Duval Street, which is the main shopping, bar & restaurant strip, however, it's a little oasis and you dont feel as if you are in a busy street, so it's a perfect location in that respect. Very nice pool, with loungers set out around it and a seperate jacuzzi. Great after a day at the beach, easpecially as the happy hour started at 5 and finished at 7. This made it easy to have a nice chilled out drink with the wife, while the kids played in the pool. Our room (a premium with two Queen size beds) was very clean and comfortable for myself and my wife plus our two children. The staff were absolutely fantastic - very friendly and could not do enough to help. I always read TripAdvisor to get recommendations but never bother (too lazy!) to leave comments after I return from a trip. However, in this case I am compelled to do so, and I would not hesitate to recommend this place if you take a trip down to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BeachFolkOhio
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing! They were courteous and so helpful in giving us ideas for restaurants, etc. since this was our first trip to Key West. The hotel is located one block off of Duval, which is extremely convenient for nightlife, etc. They offer a nice breakfast and happy hour, both of which are complimentary. The entire property is extremely clean and the pool, hot tub and waterfall in the enclosed lush garden area is a wonderful way to relax. We have stayed at much pricier hotels that were not nearly as nice as this establishment. We will definately return to the Almond Tree Inn.!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and happy hour”
Reviews.Author: SCUBA_in_Caribbean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn in March 2010 for 4 nights or so. We had a 2 Queen suite with pull out sofa bed that provided adequate room for us. The room was very clean and housekeeping did a fantastic job. The grounds were nice and clean. The pool was a little small, but didn't bother us. The happy hour special was amazing and really sets this hotel apart from a lot of others. The front staff was very friendly and accommodating. The bathroom & shower is very small, but was functional. The location is great as its right at Duval St and only about a 6 block walk to the Mallory Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Almond Tree is Pure! We reaffirm the nearly unanimous positive reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Novemdecillion
Reviews.Content: Most Key West adults should find this an terrific place to call home; The ideal location is just steps from the great craziness of Duval St. and only a 5 minute walk to Sunset Beach...which is perfect. It has the family owned/operated ambiance of a B&B, while still offering the autonomy of a small hotel. The poolside rooms are not large, but tasteful, immaculate, and have Ritz touches like fluffy beach towels,pillowtop beds & terryrobes. The pool isn't lap length, but ample and attractive, hot tub was perfect temp and a quiet joy at midnight, and the handsome waterfall behind it , created nice splashing sounds & overcame All street noise. The comp. continental breakfast-unlike most-included asst. fresh fruit, juices, Hot toasted bagels &french toast , sweetrolls & yoghurt and very good fresh coffee. The comp. happy hour 5-7pm poolside offered decent wines,a beer selection, cheese&crackers and hors d'oeurves...and very nice adult travelers to meet. The owner was frequently hosting and helps to prove their patio sign which states (roughly) "There are no strangers here...just friends who haven't previously met" Solo female travelers were very comfortable here. Someone might complain about a $7 parking fee...but it's higher almost everywhere else...and the lot is 50 feet from a 24hr. CVS for any traveler needs:sundries, snacks,wines,aspirin,etc. If all small (15-25 room) hotels were run with attention to detail like this one, the world would be a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position just off Duval Street, lovely room and courtyard garden and so welcoming”
Reviews.Author: RosalieChieveley
Reviews.Content: This was just a fantastic place to stay. We spent two nights here and loved the whole experience. It was in a lovely, quiet courtyard position set back from the street but just around the corner from Duval Street. We were made to feel very welcome and our room was lovely - a king bed suite on the upper floor with ensuite shower room. The courtyard garden is so pretty, with a covered corner area for a lovely continental breakfast and an evening happy hour (two hours) where we were given a hot saucepan of chilli with vegetable chips on the side and other nibbles (it was chilly our first night!) and red or white wine. We met other fellow travellers and the breakfast and happy hour facilities are provided free! The rooms contained everything you could want: coffee making facilities, two bottles of water and a packet of biscuits (provided), towelling robes and great shampoo, lotions, etc. We were very impressed indeed and certainly plan to go back. If we had to find a small gripe, it would only be that the shower was rather lacking in power and probably needs to be replaced in the upcoming refurbishment. This was a reasonably expensive B & B, but we felt we had excellent value for money and the staff were lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but they tried to scam me after the fact”
Reviews.Author: TheDaneChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and clean, that much is true, but the scam afterwards is the problem. Had a great stay but it was about $800 for two nights. Problem occurred when we got home. A big charge appeared on our card with no explanation. When I called to question it the person on the phone accused us of stealing a rug. We were in Key West with our car parked in their lot for most of the day after we checked out and no one ever raised any issue with us, they simply put a whopping charge on our bill later. Repeated calls to reach the manager about the dispute went unheeded. At least 5 calls were answered by a human, I left my number, but no call back, EVER. I finally submittied it to the fraud department of my credit card company which removed the item. Why would anyone steal a rug? I am not even sure if there was a rug in the room. Why wouldn't they call me back? Rather than try to sneak a charge onto the city slickers card, they should have just reported it to the police. It ended up being a thoroughly disgusting hotel experience and we will NOT be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: SugarGroveBride
Reviews.Content: Here are some highlights - PROS - Check in was quick and easy! Very friendly and approachable staff. We were so impressed how Alex always remembered and used our names. A small thing that makes you feel special and a home! Breakfast and Happy Hour really made the price of the hotel an even better bargain! Quiet atmosphere and the lights around the trees at night make it a super cool vibe! Comfortable cushions on the pool chairs! Accessability to scooters, bicycles, snacks and the booking kiosks for watersports and excursions made it so easy to wake up and get your day started with NO hassle! Good amount of sun around the pool. Lots of the hotels have soooo many trees that the pools are really shady. Showers had plenty of hot water and great water pressure. Nice Bath & Body Works soaps and lotions! The location was just wonderful.....not too close to the noise and madness that Duvall can offer, but not too far either. Just a couple minute walk to Bahama Village, Key Lime Square and the Southernmost point. CONS - Limited amount of seating around the pool....which is to be expected at a small Inn like this. The cushions on the pool lounges were always very wet in the morning, so sitting there in street clothes didn't work. We booked through Travelocity and thought we were getting a King Suite (bed + seating area). We didn't have a seating area and the mattress in our room (#102) was super old and needed to be replaced!!! Other guests said that their beds were comfortable, so i think that maybe our room was next on the list for replacement. I should always know to book directly through the hotel to get a better room. Fortuantely, the drinks, activity and fresh air that we enjoyed during the day made it very easy to sleep :) Book this hotel and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort, excellence”
Reviews.Author: momelise
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my visit to Key West in January. The room was comfortable and attractive. There is a 24 hour CVS next door, a drop-off laundry across the street (and a Denny's, which I assume is open 24 hours, but didn't check on). The Inn is steps away from Duval and about 3/4 mile, if that, from Mallory Square. My one complaint is that the attractive courtyard area draws late night conversation, naturally, and laughter and animated conversation seems to really carry in the night air. I don't think hotel staff stays on-sight, and so there is no one to remind people to keep their conversation muted. (And in Key West, where drinking is a highly promoted activity, people aren't necessarily as considerate as they might ordinarily be.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mark5447
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Great pool, fun happy hour, and big clean rooms. Shea was very helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “IT can not be better..Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: westwidetraveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my Wife stayed here for 2 nights during Christmas 2009 vacation. The place could not be any better than this. Starting from checking to check out, 2 days later...we had amazing time. The room was spacious..the small tropical look with a pool and lots of trees and a small water fall makes the atmosphere more romantic and relaxing. On top of that breakfast and happy hour was great...good food and the counter person was always smiling and taking care of you....he even suggested us many places to visit in key west that is only known to locals... And Location...Amazing..right on the intersection of Truman and Duval st....all the attractions are walking distance.. We will definitely be back here whenever we have chance. I would highly recommend this place to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BentPedersen
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to stay two nights at the Almond Tree Inn in Key West. After looking for a place with space for 3 kids and 2 adults, we were adviced to visit this place. We had a perfect room with two beds and a pull out and for the first time we felt warm and nice during our breakfast, we ate outside... The happy hour was a welcoming treat for us before walking down town to eat. Nice place to spent a couple of day, we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,nice rooms and a incredibly friendly and helpfull staff!”
Reviews.Author: J4444c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 2 days here celebrating are 45th anniversary. They staff here could not have been nicer. They gave us an upgrade to a suite at no extra cost after they found out we were celebrating our anniversary. They have a very nice happy hour each evening between 5-7 with free food, beer and wine, and in the morning they have continental breakfast from 7-10. The room was very nice size, but as one reviewer said the shower was a little small. Trust me that is as close to a complaint you get from me. One day I asked one of the managers were I could get a paper, he asked local or National, and what does he do but come back with both and would not take any money. So if you are not looking for the big buck resorts but want a place that's comfortable, reasonable, great location to everything and with a great staff, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Best find in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: lmarnold36
Reviews.Content: This was truly the best find so far in Key West...at the time...since then the rates have increased and, in todays economy, we can no longer justify staying there at the current rate that was quoted...even though we LOVE the property! My boyfriend, myself, and a friend of ours stayed at this hotel in October 2008. We absolutely fell in LOVE with this hotel. The location was PERFECT! It is closer to the south end of Duval but in reasonable walking distance to any of the bars and/or attractions on the northern (I would not recommend the walk in heels though). The hotel is less then a block off Duval but you could never tell when you are on their property. They have a great little rock waterfall that flows into a pond with some fish. The pool is a nice size and never felt too crowded during the day. The lanscaping is wonderful and makes you feel like you are in your own little tropical oasis. We stayed in one of the attached villas and it was wonderful. The room was spacious enough for the 2 of us, the bed was extremely comfortable, and there was plenty of counterspace to get ready. My only complaint was that the shower was a little small but it worked out just fine. The staff was helpful. We never made it to the breakfast but Denny's was almost across the street so it was very convenient. For lunch there is a local deli across the street and subway next door in the shopping plaza. Also in the shopping plaza is a CVS incase you want to pick up some beverages for your room or if you have forgotten anything. Again, they have set the landscaping up so well you can not even tell there is anything around you so you would know that a shopping plaza was next door. Altogether this hotel was great. I wish we could have stayed there again this year but as I stated in the beginning, the price was just too high for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: amd78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn in Key West for 1 night. We wish we would've stayed longer! The staff was super friendly and helpful and the rooms are very nicely decorated and very clean! We had a room on the lower level facing the pool and it was great! We had our own personal porch where you could sit and relax. Very nice! They also have a happy hour from 5-7 where they serve drinks and snacks. We didn't partake in this as we were out exploring the town, but we did partake in the continental breakfast and it was very good. The staff works extra hard here to ensure that you have a good time in a clean place! We are definitely returning to this motel!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bergenroze
Reviews.Content: Great room and easy walking distance from all major attractions. Hotel staff was very friendly! The pool and hot tub are open 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “a Little Treasure in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_Corrigan
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree is a cozy and intimate setting with the friendliest staff. Our visit to the Keys was 9/12-9/17/09 during one of the least busiest weeks of the year. We had no prior reservations and pulled into the Almond Tree after scouting out some other properties nearby. The Almond Tree was actually the best rate based on the accomodations we could find - a large "suite" with a seperate livng area, wet bar, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker, coffee cups, glasses and 2 Queen Size beds $109.00/night. The room was tastefully decorated "island style", was very clean, and comfortable. The vanity area is separate from the bathroom and very spacious with complimentary "Bath and Body "products. The shower (no tub) was a bit on the cozy, small side. We had a private patio just outside our front door with a great seating area. The mattresses on the beds could be improved as they were a bit on the lower end of quality but, this was a minor issue for us. We thourghly enjoyed the waterfall pool, jacuzzi, and outdoor seating area that is very intimate in size and surrounded by lush, tropical foilage. The complimentary continental breakfast and "Happy Hour" was an added bonus. They offered yogurt, toast, fruit, bagels in the morning and can beer, wine and snacks for Happy Hour 5-7pm. The location is Perfect......Duval Street is practically at your door step and if you visit Key West this is where you will want to be. You can't beat this place. If you visit be sure to speak with Shae and Sean. They both work at the reception area and are incrediably accomodating to their guests. They genuinely strive to make your stay the most comfortable it can be at the Almond Tree Inn and the greater Key West Area. Shea if you read this...I miss the Heat!! :) Way to Go Almond Tree team!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better stay”
Reviews.Author: FlyingJello
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of six guys and found this place to be a perfect place to stay at a very reasonable price. It is located right off of Duval Street in a perfect location; close to all the bars and restaurants. The rooms and pool were very nice, the staff was very accommodating and the free happy hour was an excellent deal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is trying to find a nice place to stay while traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “We had a GREAT Time!”
Reviews.Author: miyar
Reviews.Content: Bill and his staff are great. We enjoyed the pool, food, and rooms are very clean. A+

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the heart of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelMiami
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that upon check out I inquired about staying here again in November to celebrate my birthday in Key West. This hotel is located three buildings off of Duval Street so dont let the address fool you. Duval street runs east to west and is about a mile and a half long. The east of Duval street is quite with many galleries. The west has the bars and Mallory Square and the nightlife. This hotel is in the middle. Once you enter the green gate you are in a little oasis with samll waterfall and koi pond. You don't hear any of the street noises. The room we had was small, but not crowded. We had a king bed. Imagine a master bedroom in a home. The room was clean and cold which is great considering the heat outside. It also had a refrigerator and microwave tucked in a granite corner. The rooms on our side of the hotel had a little porch divided by a white gate and green shutters from the other rooms. The room was right in front of the pool. We didnt use the pool but it was very convenient to be so close to it. The hotel offers free breakfast and happy hour. The breakfast is a continental breakfast and has awesome coffee and different juices. Happy hour includes free beer by the can and wine by the cup with other snacks. After a hot day walking around it's a nice welcome back to the hotel before venturing out again for dinner. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Beautiful, and Friendly Staff....Jose was beyond Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jaredt
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you this was the best place to stay at...Almond Tree Inn is the place you want to be.....Regard reviews that r pertaining to negative issue regarding this inn. Jose was beyond excellent from great places for Dinner, Lunch, and Water adventures during our visit to Key West. He's a native and you'll get all the hot points and places of Key West . Cozy and Beautiful Rooms and Courtyard leading to a piece of paradse. There's absoulety no bad things about this Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: Guikema
Reviews.Content: While I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for the first night of my honeymoon, my husband and I found the hotel to be very charming and nice. The staff seemed to be friendly and the room was nice. Although we had a nice stay while at the hotel, I encountered problem upon check out, and then after. When I checked out, the manager notified me that he was going to charge my credit card. I notified him that we had already paid over the phone when I reserved the room...to my surprise, later that day when I checked my bank acct, he charged me again. I called the hotel to straighten out issue, and the manager argued with me. Eventually agreeing to credit my account, I kept my eye out for it, and eventually did get the refund, however, also got another charge. This time the charge was for DOUBLE the original room rate! I called again, and the manager again argued with me. I was on day 3 of my 10 day honeymoon with $200 left in my account. I had to wait 2-3 days further to get the money refunded, and also had to deal with my bank, and the horrible customer service of the manager at the hotel. I have since mailed a letter of complaint to the owner, still no response from him. I have called daily- but get the same response from the staff "Bill is out of town" and they never know when to expect him back. I am very dissatisfied with how this has turned out, and I advise you to look at your bank accounts when you leave. Just a word of advice, if you pay before you check out, keep your payment confirmation number handy!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sungodess35
Reviews.Content: We loved the Almond Tree Inn, we were able to check in early for our 1 night stay. We drove down from Miami for my husband's Birthday. They were very friendly with fresh cookies in the lobby, and they called us when our room was ready (3 hours prior to regular checkin) and we walked Duval and had a drink...or 2... The room was very clean and very updated, spacious and comfortable. The pool is beautiful and relaxing - bring a book! Linens were very nice and clean. The complementary daily happy hour was awesome, with a few yummy snacks, wine and beer. and free internet access. We loved the location and the comfort, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: harrypalace
Reviews.Content: just got back from key west after celebrating my 40th birthday with friends. after reading many reviews on hotels before going i chose the almond tree and booked 6 rooms, it was everything i expected and more.location is great,hotel staff very nice and helpful,lovely pool and gardens,rooms were nice though would recomend upgrading to suite if you can.happy hr was great! and they have a great deli across street which was excellent.will definately be staying here again as will my friends. ps never normally take time out to write reviews so this must be good!

Reviews.Title: “Just as I expected it to be...”
Reviews.Author: KRW39
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews hear, I had high expectations for the Almond Tree. This was our 9th trip to Key West but our first stay at Almond Tree. We stayed May 7th-12. I won't go into every detail of the rooms, breakfast, happy hour, etc. Suffice it to say that all of the positive reviews on TA are right on the mark. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, checking in and out was quick and efficient. Location was perfect as well. We will definitely stay at The Almond Tree again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional accomodations and friendly courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: CherieHtownTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at another hotel on Duval St on a previous visit to Key West, which had a four star rating, but the room, hotel amenities, and service by the staff of the Almond Inn by far, exceeded those of that hotel. The hotel is one block off of Duval which is the heart of Key West, restaurants and shopping are in walking distance. The hotel is in a quiet tropical setting. The rooms are beautifully decorated and have a mini fridge and microwave with a separate sitting area. We plan to go to Key West every other year for Christmas and the Almond Inn is where we will stay. There is an Internet cafe right next to the hotel. Cheryl A and Wayne A, Houston, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Lovely oasis just off the main drag in Key West”
Reviews.Author: NoneyJ
Reviews.Content: We chose the Almond Tree Inn after reading the reviews on Trip Adviser and were not disappointed one bit. It is a lovely small guest house in a great location just off Duval Street. The Happy Hour was a pleasant extra and breakfast was very nice. The pool is smallish but very clean and set very attractively in the centre of the property. There are plenty of loungers too and good quality ones. The room is fairly dark but attractively furnished and very clean. The only downside we found was that the room we were in was directly next to the pool - which on one hand is fantastic for that early morning dip but there were a couple of guests when we were there who had obviously been enjoying the mojito's in Key West and sat in the pool area and spa until around 3am. They were loud enough to disturb us and prevent us sleeping. We could have asked them to be quiet but they were having fun - and looked very shabby the next day!

Reviews.Title: “very nice inn”
Reviews.Author: mrsraisin
Reviews.Content: Ten of us took this trip, five of us have been to Key West before, first time here at Almond Tree. Staff very friendly, rooms very clean, the pool was wonderful. Stopped on the way to inn to get cheap coolers and a stock of beer to have around the pool. Most rooms had a gated patio, kept our beer out there, was very handy while sunning and swimming. We all will be back, truly a hidden gem. Location was a little far but gave us excercise. nice little breakfast and happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: sillydoc
Reviews.Content: The pictures don't do this place justice! The hotel is small but has a nice garden pool and clean spacious rooms. The hotel staff was really friendly and they had free beer and wine at happy hour every night! Just off the main drag it was very convenient and well-priced!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cperry43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Almond Tree Inn from Jan 12 - 15 and had a wonderful stay! It is the perfect location (Truman and Duval.) It is an easy walk to all of the action but far enough away. We had the deluxe king suite and it was very clean and modern. We called around to several other B&Bs but the Almond Tree had the best prices and the best amenities. The courtyard with the pool and hot tub was a secluded oasis where we could escape after experiencing Duval Street. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location, would come back”
Reviews.Author: humanetraveler
Reviews.Content: Almond Tree Inn, November 2008, We had a very nice time for the 4 nights we stayed their prior to Thanksgiving week. The rates included daily continental breakfast, and a two hour happy hour every evening with appetizers. We reserved a suite at a little more than $200.00 per night, parking was an extra $7.00 per night. Our room was located upstairs on the end. Very clean and in good repair. Shower was a little tight, but it worked. The Almond Tree Inn is actually laid out like a motel , not sure if it was at some point but now large portion of area is covered with beautiful vegetation. Staff was helpful and friendly. Location is great less than a block off Duval Street. I would definitely stay there again, and would recommend it as a nice quiet location to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Key West”
Reviews.Author: DO'H1
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to repeat everything in all of the other reviews and am just posting this to let you know that the Almond Tree hasn't changed and lives up to everything written about it here on TripAdvisor. A lovely place to spend Christmas Day for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rashmask
Reviews.Content: Almond Tree is a great place to stay. Very tropical set up.It's not a typical bed and breakfast or a hotel. We took a king bed room pool side. Very spacious rooms and comfortable bathroom. The room has all the basic facilities - iron/dryer/ TV/Phone/i Home speakers etc. The place is very clean and the location was perfect for us. Half a block from Duval Street and right opposite bike rentals. It was easy for us to rent and return our bike. The staff is very helpful. Gave us good advice on things we could do in Key West. The best part they had parking included. But make sure it is because when we booked our room online they told us that the parking was included but when we were checking in they said its $7 per day. But once we told that we were told its free they did not charge us :) The happy hour was good fun as well! They had good variety of wines and beer. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DanNorway
Reviews.Content: My 3 brothers and I gave our father a 10 days trip to Florida as a birthday gift, and the main reason for choosing Florida was shark fishing in Key West. His 4 sons did of course join him. We drove down to Key West after staying the first night in Miami. We have rented 2 convertibles, and the nature experience and view along the road to Key West in a convertible is fabulous!! Highly recommended, as you donâ€™t sit in the back seat. We didnâ€™t book any hotel in advance, so we used proximately 30 minutes to get a room after arriving in Key West. Almond Tree Inn had a room that accommodated us all. If Iâ€™m not wrong, did our little brother sleep on the floor J The room was great, clean and well furnished. They had a small but nice swimming pool that we enjoyed. We all loved their Happy Hour in the afternoon were we got served free beer. The hotel is located close to Duval Street and all the main locations and happenings. We loved our stay at almond Tree, and we loved Key West.

Reviews.Title: “just average”
Reviews.Author: travelanne7
Reviews.Content: While this place is OK, it isn't really a traditional B&B in terms of comfort or breakfast. The breakfast menu never changed...and it was all store bought pastries and the "french toast" was frozen from a package. Fruit was not cut up, just plunked in a dish for you to peel. The mattress was so bad we moved to another lodging after 2 nights. The AC is right next to the bed fo you can freeze or be too hot. The room is clean, very small window (was very dark) and is furnished just like a Marriott hotel. This is more of a small motel than a Florida Key West kind of B&B .

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality WAY down south!”
Reviews.Author: Hammer4Homes
Reviews.Content: I first apologize to the Almond Tree - I thought I wrote a review when we went (July 28 - Aug 1 08), but just noticed I had not. That is a shame, because the Almond Tree is certainly worth letting people know about. The staff is extremely friendly, the other guests were equally friendly (especially the family with two sons from England), the accomodations very clean and kept, and the seclusiveness of the courtyard was very well thought out. They have a privacy gate you pass through; just after that is a small waterfall to one side. This waterfall is very soothing, not loud at all, but - just enough to make the sounds from the street completely disappear. Very nice and effective touch! And, a complimentary breakfast, and a complimentary early evening happy hour of nice wines and beer - such a nice touch. If we had any idea how nice this place was going to be, we would have booked it for more nights. But - this is absolutely something to look forward to on our next trip to Key West! (it is also about 200 feet off of Duval, and on Truman which is the street that brings you in. No having to hunt around to find it - there it is!) Thank you again to all at the Almond Tree for helping to make Key West a truly hospitable destination!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: tracy8365
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult find fault with this wonderful little hotel. We stayed in the King Suite for 3 nights at the end of September 2008. A great location in a strongly recommended area. The hotel is in old town, on Truman street which is just off Duval street and only a few blocks from the Hemingway house. The continental breakfast was delightful and there was a good selection ranging from fruit, yogurt, bagels, French toast, cereals and danishes. There was a happy hour every night from 5pm to 7pm where drinks were free and snacks were served. The gardens were beautiful with well established trees, plants and flowers. It is obvious that the owners and staff take great pride in working here and keeping it well managed. The rooms were luxurious and the bed was the comfiest I have ever slept in. The air con was quiet and a perfect temperature. We cannot wait to go back. Thank you to all for making our Key West experience perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Most romantic little hide-away right on Duval St”
Reviews.Author: miamigrrl46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property in the past & always loved it. This time it was our 20th anniversary & We had just a short time to get away. We looked at other places for about & hour & again returned to The lovely oasis of the Almond Tree. The manager Jose, was courteous and even remembered us from last fall. He gave us a beautiful romantic king room upstairs for our anniversary. They had added new luxury duvet bedding & a sexy shag rug right next to "his side of the bed" this year. We love the olde feel of the property,but every modern amenity is in place and does not clash with the elegant/decadent Keys feel the place exudes. The clean glassbrick shower, outside powder room With lighted Mag mirror really makes getting ready for a special night out easy on a couple of 20 years. They do a lovely happy hour from 5-7PM with varied nibbles & an "extras" style continental in the AM ( No stale box doughnuts here) it is fresh fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs & bagels to fresh raisin toast. The pool, hot tub, rooms & everything is immaculate. The landscaping had been redone since our last visit & we thought it looked even more beautiful and refined. The HK staff is friendly and non-intrusive, but will do everthing to accomodate a guest, including our little electric scooters we had to plug in thier area, or in our room. Don't miss the chance to shower up & don the spa style bathrobes they provide before you dress for the evening *wink* We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place!”
Reviews.Author: likry
Reviews.Content: This is a great place! My family of 5 stayed here Aug. 12 and 13. We had a 2 bedroom queen suite, rm 111. A sofa bed, table and chair and armoire with TV filled the room which was nicely decorated in a British Colonial scheme. The beds were on the firm side, but comfortable. The gounds are very lush with a waterfall Koi pond, a spa, pool and a shaded sitting area. Fabulous colorful flora and cute little lizards which are fun to watch scurying about! Internet service is provided free, but works best when sitting outside. The inn is located less than 1 block from Duval St. on the quieter side, but withing walking distance to most things. Right next door on Truman St. is a drug store, pizza shop and a few other stores. A breakfast with loads of choice including french toast is provided each morning and a happy hour at 5 pm with beer, wine, cheese and crackers and fresh fruits was nice too. My only gripe would be the bathroom. It was just too small. The toilet and glass block shower are in one room. There was just no room to even turn around! A large person could have difficulty. There was a very large area with the granite top sink which could have been used as a dressing area except there was no door. It seems that the bathroom design wasn't laid out in the most optimal way. An accordian door could easily provide a private dressing area. All in all it is a very comfortable, quiet and clean place to relax at after a long day of siteseeing or water adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luck!”
Reviews.Author: WISadventure
Reviews.Content: After making a last minute decision to travel to Key West for the first time, my wife and I had no reservations and only an idea to stay in Key West for a couple nights. I walked off the street and through the front door, met Kim -who was wonderfully kind - and booked a room, and was unsure as to what we would find upon entering the room. We were thrilled once we opened the door to the king suite. The room was comfortable, clean, and cute. We loved it! We strolled through the courtyard before heading a 1/4 block to Duval St. only to observe a number of the guests hanging out by the Pavillion Bar for a complimentary happy hour. People were friendly, relaxed, and happy. Why wouldn't they be so laid back? The setting of the courtyard seduces those who pass through. We enjoyed our first two nights so much that we decided to extend our stay in Key West and our stay at the Almond Tree Inn.
