The only thing I would change is reserving a room for the Almond Tree instead of chancing it. It was pure luck that we pulled into the Almond Tree's lot and scored a room. Pros: Close to all the major sites, private rooms, friendly staff, wonderful pool and courtyard, generous continental breakfasts and happy hours, coffee shop and ATM next door, and safe. Cons: We've been home for a couple hours, and we still cannot think of any.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Kirkolam
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree is in a fantastic location, just round the corner from Duval Street, and a 10 minute walk down Duval Street to Mallory Square. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. The whole atmosphere is very chilled out. There is a great little pool and hot tub, and very pretty bijou grounds â€“ we had a mini-waterfall and a pond with tropical fish right outside our room! The staff are very friendly and helpful and provide very personalised, caring service. They provide a great continental breakfast free of charge, and there are free drinks and nibbles at happy hour each night. There is a car park (costs a very reasonable $7 per day). It is good value for money. I just wish we had been able to stay longer! If we go back to Key West, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: SvenskaGirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of staying at the Almond Tree Inn last week. It's ideally located, near the Hemingway House and a short walk down to the must-see tourist-laden Duval Street and Mallory Square sunset shows. The hotel has a large pool and hot tub, lush landscaping, and competent caring employees. They really made us feel at home, and we felt they really wanted to share the best that Key West could offer by recommending restaurants and tours that were ideally suited to the individual. Our upstairs suite was beautifully decorated, extremely clean and very quiet. And the bed seemed very cushy (maybe more so because of a bad Miami experience). You pay to park the car in the lot, but I think that's the norm in crowded Key West. We liked everything about the hotel, I'd recommend it highly to any friend. And having the owner's dog in the office during the day gave me my dog fix during our visit!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sfmtc123
Reviews.Content: Staff was courteous and helpful. Happy hour should have a person behind the counter at all times; however, not many places have a happy hour such as this one so beggars can't be choosers. Lovely landscape with the fish ponds and tropical plants surrounding gave it a Caribbean feel. The rooms were spacious and luxurious with more than enough pillows. Great experience. Would definintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: canuck1956
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were booked in for 3 nights but ended up staying 5 because we loved it so much. Extrememly well taken care of and really friendly staff. The courtyard is a lovely oasis with pool with a waterfall in it, hot tub and gorgeous, lush greenery everywhere.....little lights wrapped around the palm trees gave it a great glow at night. I can't say enough good things about our beautiful room, wow, the bed was so comfy and the linens were heavenly.....we never wanted to get up! Each room has a large private patio too. The resort is very conducive to meeting people because of the courtyard and the breakfast and happy hour. We met some great couples there. The place is quiet and relaxing so if you're looking to just chill out, stay there. Everyone we met here said they loved it and some had stayed there several times before. Even though it's very close to all the Duval hubbub we never heard a thing and i'm a light sleeper. So we give this guest house a 10 and we will certainly be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “beautifully presented”
Reviews.Author: MnmsUk
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, the flowers in the reception were beautiful, the whole Inn was done with great taste and style. We enjoyed staying at the Almond Tree very much. The room had 2 double beds and a sofa bed (which was very comfortable): we all slept well. There was a lovely terrace area on the 2nd floor (1st floor to us Brits) just outside our room, which we enjoyed using very much. The pool was fairly small but, being an interesting L-shape and surrounded by a nice garden and all the sun loungers and the tables and chairs, felt larger than it actually was. There was pizza, together with chips/ crisps and dips at happy hour, as well as cold drinks, beer and wine, which was all very welcome. In fact we didnâ€™t have an evening meal out at all in Key West â€“ we enjoyed Happy Hour and then ate food from Sunnyâ€™s deli and sandwich shop (which was just across the road) on â€œourâ€� terrace area later on in the evening. The only negative things were the fact that there was a party of â€œSpring Breakersâ€� at the Inn â€“ all perfectly polite and reasonable but any big group can be a little off-putting. Also the noise from what I think was the pool house was initially disturbing on the upstairs terrace (not at all from the room though). The road noise (we were right on Truman Avenue) felt distant and was not a problem. On the afternoon we arrived we were impressed to see a three-foot lizard run across the road. Breakfast was OK, although we were surprised that we ate from throw- away plates (is this because of a lack of water in the keys?). The location was good, and although not right amongst the old town house area, and walking to the harbour or the pirate museum was only 15 minutes. Â£172 a night. Our hire-car stayed in the good hotel car park the whole time we were there. It was a lovely hotel and the managers and all the staff were friendly and great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, nice people”
Reviews.Author: EandBAmbler_Pa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Almond Tree on March 17-18, 2008. It is located just off Duval street a pleasant walk from both the "southern most point" and Mallory Square. Its also two blocks from the Hemmingway House. The facility is well cared for with a pleasant owner who is on the property much of the time. They serve a nice continental breakfast as well as a pleasant happy hour with beer, wine and cheese and crackers. The rate seemed competitive with other hotels in the vicinity, but it is not a beach location, nor is it a fancy large hotel with big lobby, restaurant, etc. If you haven't been to Key West before, we found renting a bike and exploring the island that way was very worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed after reading such high ratings”
Reviews.Author: natureniche
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Inn and there were many plusses to this inn. Most of those have already been described in other reviews; the relaxing poolside atmosphere, the hosts, the happy hour plus breakfast spread. But here are some of the things that surprised us. The bathroom arrangement was cramped. The shower stall was more like a cattle chute than anything else I can use to describe. The toilet and shower area had a pocket door that did not shut properly or lock. it was separate from the sink and mirror. We shared an upstairs suite with our 2 adult daughters, but most suites we have rented before have a separate room This suite was all one long room and not all that big either. I understand space is a premium in Key West and this reflected that. The bed headposts were supposed to be screwed onto the wall but one of them had come away from the wall in our room and in the room next to us I think. I heard evidence of headboard banging at 2:30 am in the next room which woke me up and kept me awake for the rest of the night. There were a number of college students staying at the inn which surprised me considering the cost. We did enjoy the upstairs patio area which offered some privacy and room when there were no available seats below. Convenient location but a bit scary to walk the streets in the early morning. A Denny's right across the street provided an early morning coffee one day.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: tjh17
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the great reviews and were not disappointed. Check in was friendly, speedy and helpful. Our room was wonderful (I especially loved the terrace where I sat with my coffee each moring enjoying the sun) Breakfast was a nice treat (and saved us from indulging in heavy bacon & eggs) It was surprisingly quiet with the location only one block from Duval St. The owner was one of the nicest people we have ever met, he even went out of his way to recommend a hotel in Miami Beach to stay at once we left Key West. The staff was very nice as well and the housekeeper gave me a little gift the day we were leaving. I absolutely loved Key West and will return soon and most definatley stay at The Almond Inn again. From Thorold, Ontario Stayed February 29 - March 3

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Over65Texas
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend. Pros: The staff was friendly and helpful, convenient location, nicely decorated. Cons: Noisy. Banging gates that can be heard all night. Drunks fighting in the courtyard at 4 AM Sunday morning. No staff on the premises after 10 PM. At checking we were given a local number to call when thereâ€™s a disturbance, but it was no real help. Better to call the local police (911) when the drunks are fighting.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tigs2699
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree in was everything we dreamed of and more. The room was huge (double queen beds) and we were quite surprised to find a mini-kitchen as well (great for keeping drinks cold). The shower was a little small, but we were too busy roaming about town to really worry about that. Outside the room, there was a pool and hot tub, which we took advantage of at all times of day. We had a little terrace outside of the room where we could have a drink and enjoy the nice breeze. Everything was immaculate and the staff was super helpful. It was a little pricey, but I would recommend the Almond Tree Inn to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsDave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Almond Tree for a few days in February 2008 and were very pleased. The staff goes above and beyond to make you happy. We arrived at around 9:30 p.m. and despite the late hour, the woman at the front desk chatted us up about the best places to go and get some food and a drink. The next morning I was attempting to re-enter our room with two cups of hot coffee no free hand to open the door. A member of the housekeeping staff--seeing the predicament I was in--dropped what she was doing and rushed over to help. The rooms are modern and clean and surround a nicely-landscaped courtyard with pool, jacuzzi, and several lounge chairs and tables. The entire hotel area is fenced in and very private. Continental breakfast is served every morning. While the food is fine, it's limited. There are some pastries, cereal, fruit, yogurt, and bagels. There's also happy hour each afternoon with beer, wine and snacks. The snacks are nothing to get excited about--crackers, chips, etc.--and the beer and wine aren't exactly top-shelf. The location is tough to beat. It's on Truman just off Duval. It's walking distance to most of the Old Town and far enough from the heart of Duval so that it's not too noisy. The only minor complaint I would have is that if people are talking outside your door, you can hear them pretty clearly, which can be annoying if you're trying to sleep in. We would definitely return to the Almond Tree on a return trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Fun Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Ann1622
Reviews.Content: We loved the Almond Tree, recommend it highly, and hope to return next year. The atmosphere is cozy, friendly, and easily accessible to all parts of the island; there's even a bike/scooter rental shop right across the street. It is within walking distance of Duval Street action, which we preferred to being right in the middle of it, and a short walk or bike ride to great restaurants, the beach, the marina, and Mallory Square. The employees couldn't be nicer, and guests included a nice mix of ages and ethnicities.

Reviews.Title: “5 STARS!!!”
Reviews.Author: micron929rr
Reviews.Content: One of the cleanest places I have ever stayed in my life. Staff was very nice, room was great.....Like a tropical paradise in the middle of the city. Nice Koi pond with waterfool...very clean pool...Highly recommended to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Island Gem”
Reviews.Author: Chrissypooh
Reviews.Content: This is such a lovely inn! Beautiful landscaping including waterfall, lush tropical plants and flowering trees. The pool is a nice size and contains a waterfall of its own. There is a hot tub as well. The rooms are very comfortable (nice bedding). We had two queens and a sitting area including a couch with a pull-out bed. Small kitchen area with waist-high sized fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The inn is kept very clean!! The continental breakfast is outstanding and can keep you going for hours before having to eat again. The happy hour is also a very nice touch with beer, wine, soft drinks and snacks. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful in many respects including arranging transportation and making dinner reservations. I would go back here in a heartbeat and cannot wait to do so!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!!”
Reviews.Author: paula4480
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth year staying at the Almond Tree. We love this place!! Bill the owner is such a sweet man that will do whatever he can to make your stay more enjoyable. The entire staff are very nice and willing to do whatever is needed. Very clean - no bugs but lots of lizards!!<G> And Justin, Spike and Clarence are wonderful also!! The pool is always a bit too cold in December for my tastes but that is not a huge deal as there is a hot tub also. I wish that they would put some plastic or something on the gates of the rooms so that they don't make so much noise but other than that, this place is just about perfect! A laundromat across the street, a CVS next door, and Duvall Street around the corner - great! We will definitely be back next December if not sooner!! Paula and Rick (Monroe, MI and Toledo, OH)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_the_w0rld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Key West and found this hotel through TripAdvisor. We had looked at pricier B&Bs but picked this one because of its rating and price. If you call the hotel directly you get a better price than one offered online. We paid about $145/night. Our stay here was wonderful! Upon informing the booking receptionist over the phone, that we were coming to be married, he offered us an upgrade to a King Suite. Upon arrival, the staff was very friendly. She offered us maps, reservation services, and a menu of all the local restaurants. The grounds were very well kept, and tastefully decorated for X-mas. Our room had a private patio with a breakfast table. Upon entering our room, the staff had a little surprise of chilled champagne awaiting us. The beds are very comfortable, rooms decorated lovely, and bath and body works ammentities. The only downside is that the rooms only have stand up showers - no bathtubs. The room also had a kitchen area with microwave, sink, and fridge that came in handy. Housekeeping was great as well. The Inn offers complimentary happy hour every night (5-7) with can beers(Bud, Miller, Coors, ect) and 4 varieties of wine. They also have complimentary snacks (pizza, chips, fresh veggies, cheese, crackers, and sausage). This is a nice time to mingle with other guests. Every morning there is also complimentary breakfast with fresh fruit, boiled eggs, pastries, juices, yogurt, bagels, toast, ect. The hottub is nice and the pool as well. However I couldn't tell the pool was heated. The Inn is located right off Duval Street so everything (except the beach) is within walking distance. Duval St. restaurants are expensive so if you're looking for cheaper food try the harbor/pier area. There is also a Walgreens right on Duval for any needs you may have. Everyone there was extremely nice and helpful with all our requests. When we return for anniversaries, we will never stay anywhere else but here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Grams6
Reviews.Content: ...What a wonderful stay we had at your motel. The weather was beautiful. The staff was great. The rooms were clean and gorgeous. Would surely come back. Thanks for your great service. Deanna Nottestad Cambridge, WI

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Almond Tree!”
Reviews.Author: paulaandscott
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 3 nights at the Almond Tree Inn for a friend's wedding weekend. Of my many visits to the keys and Key West, I've only stayed in private homes. So, I was nervous about staying in a "hotel" for this visit. Friends raved about it, and the reviews looked good. The cleanliness was the most impressive. (And, that was what I was most worried about!) Everything was close by-great location! Bed and linens were cozy, cool, and crisp. Little fridge and microwave were a nice convenience. Pool was very warm, but they were having an unusually hot October. At a friend's home, a few blocks away, their pool was exactly the same....very warm! After a rainstorm, on our last day, the pool was perfect! I guess that is my only complaint....the pool was not refreshing for the hot weather. Happy Hr. and breakfasts were very varied and great. Yogurt and fresh fruit (my fav. along with sweets!) were also available with a variety of other breakfast foods. As we had events planned for each early evening, we only enjoyed happy hr. as we were heading out each day.....good selections of beer and wine. This was also my shortest visit to the keys, and we were not ready to leave. We will be back to the Almond Tree Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Another great welcoming stay- love it here”
Reviews.Author: Ruthebest
Reviews.Content: Thank you Almond Tree for another great stay. great price, great location, lovely friendly staff- Diane and Trudy, you could not ask to stay in such a lovely place, everything to hand and nothings to much trouble for the staff. Thanks again, see you next year x

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Key West Secret”
Reviews.Author: trxy
Reviews.Content: My daughter, son in law, husband and myself spent 3 days in Key West staying at the ALMOND TREE INN. It was wonderful . The Inn is located just off Duval St. It is an older, small hotel that has been completely remodeled.. Our room was very large, with a sitting area with fridge, two extremely comfortable queen beds, a very large dressing area, and a pretty bath with a glass block shower. All linens and towels were of high quality. The pool area was very unique with a waterfall. Every evening Happy Hour was provided with beer, wine and a large variety of snacks served pool side and under covered tables. A great breakfast was also served every morning in the same location. The staff and guests were all having lots of fun together as the Inn is small and everyone got to know each other. We were so very pleased with our discovery and will never stay any where else.. It had the atmosphere of a B&B but the privacy and quality of a 5 star hotel at very resonable rates..

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: jd38
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the few on Key West that could accommodate a family of 5, a sofa bed is in the hotel room. Not a particularly cheap Motel but well worth the money. Located just off the main street of Key West. Once you are parked at the motel, Mallory Square is about 15 minutes walk. Amazingly the hotel is very close to all the bars and shops but very quiet on a night. There were no other children in the motel when we were there, I suggest if you have children ask for an upstairs room or one in a single storey (we could hear people walking around upstairs). The owners are really friendly and having breakfast outside was lovely. Rooms were very airy, ceiling fan made the room lovely and cool. Rooms also have safes in the rooms. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Almond Tree Inn, Key West FL”
Reviews.Author: RobLar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a five night stay at the Almond Tree Inn (8/20-8/24). The accommodations were excellent, the amenities including pool, Continental breakfast and "Happy Hour" consistently exceeded our expectations. The other patrons were all very approachable and very friendly. A nice touch to weary travelers. Above all, the staff was exceptionally helpful. Their personal service was superior. They assisted us in planning our day trips (all excellent suggestions) as well as directing us to the "local" restaurants and art galleries. Compliments to them all: Jose, Denise, Trudy & Diane. You were all so great. Thanks and to turn a phrase "we'll be back!" Lastly, the proprietor (whose name I never did learn) was very congenial and not overly patronizing. This suited us just fine because he is such a gentlemen. Rob & Laura glushakow

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Option”
Reviews.Author: ThreeRivers75
Reviews.Content: Incredible property, located a half block from Duval Street. Easy access to everything in Key West. Spacious comfortable room with sitting area, small fridge and microwave. Bath and Body Works soaps and shampoos. Great staff and friendly service, attentive immediately to every need and request. Continental breakfast and nightly reception great! Off street parking available at $5/day. Despite fronting on Truman, a wall around the pool really does block all the noise. Well maintained landscape with some water features, nice pool, very relaxing setting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Arnie67
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about this place. We stayed here for a long weekend and felt completely relaxed the moment we walked into The Almond Tree. You would never know how nice it is until you walked through the gate. Even though it is on a busy street, it is set back enough that you will not hear the street noise. There are also 2 waterfalls on property that help set a relaxing tone. Our room was on the first floor, just off the pool area and had a queen bed, nice inside sitting area, fridge, microwave, desk and a safe. There was also a nice outside sitting area. The room was clean and had Bath and Body amenities. They staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was included and it had things like French Toast, bagels, fresh fruit, pastries, hard boiled eggs, coffee and a couple of juices. In the afternoon they have a Happy Hour with cheeses, sausages, crackers wine and beer. They even had pizza one day!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME. . HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!”
Reviews.Author: MelisaFla
Reviews.Content: WOW! Key West lodgings are very "hit or miss", and I was nervous booking here b/c it's hard to tell from just pics. . but I was VERY pleasantly surprised! Room was immaculate and spotlessly clean, looked like it was newly remodeled and furnished. Pool, hot tub,and grounds were beautiful, & price includes free drinks at happy hour every night poolside, and breakfast. Staff is VERY nice and friendly, and don't forget, parking is only $5.00 a day! (very cheap for Key West where parking is very difficult!) Also a great location. . right off of Duval St., next door is a 24 hour CVS and across the street a 24 hour Denny's Diner. I'd DEFINITELY stay here again! We got the queen suite. . it was 2 queen beds, a queen pull out couch, and a small kitchenette area. . . just enough for 6 people. (but note, only one bathroom). If you want a clean, tastefully decorated place at a good location and at a reasonable price, this place IS IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Almond Tree”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea76
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Almond Tree. The location was fabulous - just off Duval street. I could walk to everything. The breakfast was just right - fruit, bagels, pastries, coffee and juice - definately won't go hungry. My room was just off the pool - very clean and quite. I would definately recommend the Almond Tree to all my friends. I Can't wait to go back to Key West and the Almond Tree. Betsy S

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelDragonFl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in June 14-15 2007. Very nice place, has its own parking lot, VERY clean. Beautiful grounds, so well maintained. The happy hour and breakfasts were fantastic!! The only problem I had were our neighbors who hogged ALL the lounge chairs ALL day (whether they were using them or not). Kept their stuff on them so no one else could use them. And they were LOUD, like drunk frat boys except they were in their 40's & 50's. My teenagers were so much better behaved. Of course this was not the fault of the hotel by any means. The hot tub was wonderful and the room was great! Very nice furniture and soaps. The private veranda in front of our room was amazing and came in so handy for wet towels and bathing suits. We will definitely stay here again, but only during the week because the weekend rates are outrageously expensive. The Duval Street action is about a mile north, so be prepared for a little bit of a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Key West hotel -- been here 4 times!”
Reviews.Author: SDAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Almond Tree in 2003, 2004, 2005 and 2007. Most recently, May 26 - May 30, 2007. That alone should tell you that we like the place and we feel that it is a good value-accomodation for Key West! One of the most recent reviews (dated 5-30-07) talks about the "terrible experience" and mentions a frat-like atmosphere. This is the time period that we were there and yes, on Sat. 5/26 the pool area was crazy and unlike ANY other visit we've had to the Inn. A bacholerette party group was there and some other college-age students. It was crowded, rowdy, loud, etc. However, this cleared up by the next day. I'll admit the management did not seem to do much to remedy the situation on that day but the hotel worker was very young and I think he felt unable to control the situation. Again, by the next day and for the remainder of our stay, the Inn was a TOTALLY different atmosphere -- the same type of Inn that we have seen on all our previous visits. We have always observed a laid-back, relatively quiet pool area where friends, couples and a few families are swimming, getting tan, having drinks and just having fun. The pool area is very nice -- lots of tropical foliage, teak furniture (this was new since our last visit in 2005) and XM radio music piped in (a soft blend of rock/pop music). I totally disagree with a previous reviewer that said it was too loud! Not even. It was set at a pleasant volume where you could hear the music and lyrics above the normal, everyday noise from the hotel patrons, cars on street, etc. (By the way, the Inn seems very separated from the roads nearby by the tall fences and foliage.) I find the Inn staff to be very friendly and helpful. They will assist in any way they can. Calling cabs when needed, finding menus of nearby restaurants, etc. The breakfast and happy hours offered by the Inn are great. For breakfast, you get things like toast (all types - wheat, white, raisin), boiled eggs, fruit, coffee and cereal. For happy hour, they offer free beer and wine. All you want... you can continue to go back again and again and there are no funny looks if you have already had three or four or five... Every time we have been, the beer is basic -- Miller Lite, Bud Lite, Budweiser. But, this time, they had some Corona, Heinken, and other bottled beer. Not sure if this is normal -- maybe it was left over beer from rooms? Oh -- they also have munchies for the Happy Hour (chips, salsa, pretzels, pizza on one day, cheese, etc.). The rooms are decorated nicely. Tropical style. The beds are very comfortable -- comfy sheets, comforter, and lots of pillows. Robes are provided. An in-room safe. Bath & Body Work amenities! I see several people that complain about the bathrooms. I'll explain the layout -- the sink/vanity is in the same room as the bedroom. Big mirror provided. The toilet and shower in a separate area beside the main room and vanity. Is it small? Not in my opinion... how much room do you need for a shower and a toilet?? There is a toilet and it is separated from the shower by one of those pretty, glass cube walls. If you are really large person, the room may not be comfortable so just keep that in mind. There is no bath tub. Location is good unless you want to be super close to the BUSY area of Duval (near Sloppy Joe's and Mallory Square). This hotel is at corner of Duval and Truman. Walk 1/2 to 3/4 mile and you are at the BUSY area. I find it to be a good central area. You can walk easily to the beach (on east side), Lighthouse, Hemigingway's house, Blue Heaven, Green Parrott (oldest bar), main Duval area with Sloppy Joe's, etc. Don't hesitate to contact me if you have questions about the Inn or Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated; bad bathroom”
Reviews.Author: queen of belize
Reviews.Content: Bad bathroom is what I most remember about this renovated old Florida motel. The new owners did nearly everything right in the extensive renovation except the bathrooms. The shower space is about 3x4. There is a silly glass block wall between the shower and toilet using up precious space. The toilet space is larger than the shower space. The same silly glass blocks are used for the window in the empty space in the sink area (why isn't this space better utilized?) and, worse yet, you can't block out the light at night. A useless blind drops down - though not quite the length of the window - but does nothing to filter the light that shines through all night long. I did not have a reservation to stay at this hotel, but stopped because of the vacancy sign. I had read the reviews before stopping here and was going off the reviews here. Bed was okay though mattress was showing wear. Rate was okay for off-season, but for the location and style of lodging, it was at the upper end. No wi-fi or high speed internet access in the room. There may be wi-fi at the office but Iâ€™m not going there in my jammies in the morning to crank up my laptop. Renovated lushly landscaped grounds are fabulous and so is staff. These guys know their business - give Americans free booze at night and free coffee and bagels in the morning and theyâ€™ll go home happy and write nice reviews. Noisiness both from upstairs and next door. Trendy Tommy Bahama style-room furnishings but like most trendy stuff, showing wear and tear after only a few years. Daily continental breakfast is cordial and social; so is afternoon happy hour. Pool/hot tub as advertised. All these nice things and these people couldn't get the bathroom right? They should admit their error, suck up the cost, and renovate the bathrooms. I'm an animal fan so I was very comfortable with the ubiquitous roosters, hens, their chicks, and the cats, one of which liked sleeping in my private little alcove. Location is at Duval and US 1 so a very busy area. Really too far to make multiple daily treks to the heart of Old Town. Close to Hemingway's house, the lighthouse, Bahama Village, and upper Duval. Staff's recommendations are hit and miss. Ask elsewhere or rely on the NY Times article which was reliable and accurate. The bartender at Roof Top Inn was the only staff person in all of Key West who would recommend one of the best places to eat on the island â€“ a locals only Cuban eatery called El Siboney; it is at the corner of streets Catherine and Margaret. A lot of the guests at this hotel hung out at the pool all day listening to the satellite radio play mind-numbing oldies at a much too â€“loud volume. If that is your idea of vacation in Key West and you donâ€™t mind the bad bathroom, you will be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place!”
Reviews.Author: Lou B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the almond tree inn from may 9-12, it was our first trip to key west. This is a lovely little hotel--it is converted from an older motel w/new furnishings Positives-- **Great location right on Duval Street--next to walgreens, across form dennys, 3 blocks from hemingway house, around the corner from old trolley stop (this is a great way to see everything on the island--you can get off and back on at any of the stops throughout the day!) **Cute rooms!--cathedral ceilings, handsome wicker decor, comfy bed, fridge and microwave (convenient for leftovers) and nice bath and body works toiletries **cute hotel--bricked in courtyard w/nice pool and koi pond/waterfall---complimentary breakfast and happy hour w/beer wine and snacks like crackers n'sausage, pizza, etc **helpful staff--could tell you where to go for anything, had lots of tour information. Can book trolley tours at the front desk **the resident cat is friendly--you'll see him at happy hour **private parking lot--$5 per day--though the only time we used our car was to drive back to the airport Negatives-- Although we didn't mind, this is a half mile walk to duval if you have problems walking far distances--but the walk wasn't bad because there's so much to look at--some closer hotels to the bars/mallory square were on fleming street like the ambrosia inn/ect. **probably just key west prices, but $235/night seemed pricey, the room was on the small side, but space was used efficiently--good enough for me and the husband--but not if you had kids General Key west tips: --don't miss the sunset celebration--! --we went to the mel fishers shipwreck museum $11 admission, very interesting to see the artifacts brought up from the sea--especially if you are into history --check out the drag show at 801 bourbon club--right down on duval from the hotel--the shows are at 9 and 11 and are only $5--worth your money in entertainment, the 'girls' are hilarious --wednesday nights at ricks bar (across from sloppy joes) they had free drinks for ladies 8-11--no cover! You could go upstairs and people watch from the roof --a good dining deal on duval--"carolines" across from hard rock--a nice sit down open air cafe w/great food and great variety at very reasonable prices for duval

Reviews.Title: “You're Crazy to Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: NHale3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Key West for a romantic vacation/belated birthday weekend. I worried for days about where to stay -- checking almost every tripadvisor review for every hotel on the island. At first I was disappointed becasue the "best rated" and most expensive hotels had a three night stay minimum and we were only going to be there for two. After reading the reviews for the Almond Tree (and knowing that the corner of Truman and Duval was a great location) I booked it. I made the right decision! You absolutely cannot beat the location of the Almond Tree. It is at the direct center of Duvall Street, so you are equidistant from the bar scene at the North End of the street and the the beach at the south end. The rooms are very nice, great robes, great sheets. Ask for Room 110, which is by the pool at the end of the hotel, it's as quiet as can be! The pool area is cozy, with music piped in and waterfalls running. The happy hour (free wine, beer and snacks) is the perfect time to have an afternoon swim and cocktails before going to dinner! And the hotel is located right accross the street from a great scooter rental place -- getting a scooter and buzzing around the island sightseeing is a MUST activity in Key West. Other recommendations include dinner at Martin's and at Louie's Backyard (tables and a bar area hidden away right on the water -- to DIE for). Both are upscale but "Key West casual", so if you're willing to spend a little more for a grat meal, both places are worth it. And you HAVE to have brunch at Blue Heaven. Outdoor seating, chickens running around, best eggs benedict we've ever had. In short, the Almond Tree is perfect for a fun, romantic getaway. You'd be insane to pay more for the super expensive places.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: zgilbert
Reviews.Content: I took a shot in the dark booking a hotel for a weekend stay at the end of April. My only requirements were being within walking distance to Duval and be relatively inexpensive. I didn't expect to find the hidden gem of Key West. If you don't mind a little bit of a walk, this is the best deal in Key West. For half the price of the high end hotels on the west side of Duval, you will have a similar, if not better, room. Although, the view, I will admit is not quite the same. But, if you plan on spending the day in your room, you're missing out. The Almond Tree is about four blocks (give or take, I am not Magellan), from the Hemingway House. Frankly, the best part about Key West is wandering around on foot. You couldn't ask for a better home base. Duval is about 50 yards south of the front entrance. The Almond Tree will be my choice every time I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are right - This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: kmbr111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the basic room but basic it wasn't. Although, smaller, the amenities were great. Staff is very helpful and friendly. The whole place was very clean and the room decor was lovely and tropical like everything else there. Everything you could need was provided - Bath and Body Works toiletries, safe, fridge, microwave, coffemaker, iron, ironing board, hair dryer,... There was no bathtub, though, just a shower and that was all we needed. Loved the little porch sitting area outside our door as well as in the common areas. As soon as you walk through the front gates, it's like you're in another world. All you hear is the calming sound of water. There's a large waterfall with fish in the front area as well as a waterfall in the pool. Continental breakfast and happy hour w/ appetizers was great. Nothing fancy but free so I was delighted. Location is great, right across from a Denny's, next to an Internet cafe, and near the center of Duval - about equal distance from the quieter Southernmost Point and the party end of Duval. On-site parking is available for $5/day - a great price. I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures do this place NO JUSTICE”
Reviews.Author: jlm_813
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely amazing! Location...great! Literally a couple steps from duval, enough to stumble home at the end of a night out! The staff were friendly, inviting and accomodating. The appearance was impecable. lush greens, beautiful flowers, and even a fountain with coy fish. I, myself, can be a little hoity toty when it comes to places I'll stay at and this place exceeded my expectations! The grounds were very relaxing, clean, NEW, and tropical. The room was perfect! Everything is new and updated. At the end of the day, sweaty, aching feet, and tipsy....i was very much looking forward to going back to this wonderful hotel and dip my feet in the warm pool and lay in a lounge chair....soaking it all in. This hotel was a wonderful experience in itself. I would definitly stay here again. I would have to book an extra night to just enjoy the relaxing atmosphere of the hotel itself!!!! Breakfast was perfect, happy hour was too. This place really takes care of you, it has everything you need! Worth every penny! Clean, private, and comfortable. I can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough Good Things!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mandalay5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little piece of paradise in Key West!! Close enough to all the attractions to leave the car (minimal per day parking charge), yet when you come back inside the hotel's courtyard, you feel a million miles away from the hustle of Duval! The free continental breakfast is substantial enough to keep you going until lunch, and free happy hour can almost substitute for a light dinner. The pool and koi pond occupied our 3-year old, and the large queen suite was plenty big for us. This was our 4th trip to Key West, 1st stay at the Almond Tree Inn, and I will never stay anywhere else again!!

Reviews.Title: “Almond Tree Inn, Clean Courteous, Respectable and Lovely Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Debbiedo
Reviews.Content: !The Almond Tree Inn was excellent. Great service, room was ready, TV cable ready, Cable Modem Laptop ready. Very Very clean. Nice free Happy Hour with Beer, Wine and snacks every day. Lovely free breakfast. Nice Owners. Perfect location. Great pool. Clean pool and Jacuzzi. Nice and quiet, great music. Beautiful gardens. My Husband and I really enjoyed it. *****5 Stars for Almond Tree Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We'd Stayed Longer!”
Reviews.Author: laing1
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree Inn is located on Truman Ave., the road that takes you to Duval St. It is on the left hand side and it is about 30 paces from the intersection of Truman and Duval. There were many noisy motorcycles going by and I did have some concerns about how close we were to Duval and car noises etc. Not to worry. On arrival there is a water feature setting the stage for an almost "spa"like experience. Stepping through the gate it is quiet. There are huge almond trees overhead, a pond with wonderful koi, a waterfall into the L shaped spotless pool, towels rolled up on the thick pads of the chaise lounges. It was SO tranquil. The room was also spotless. Marble counter with lots of varied amenities, lotions, gels shampoo etc etc, a microwave, a small fridge, thick comfy white robes to use, king size bed with 4 pillows, wonderful bed linens that had to be 300 count or higher, the theme of the room was caribbean and very tastefully done. Well at 5 we went out our door for the complimentary beer/wine/soda and lots of appetizers. This lasts until 7 but we only stayed a short time as we HAD to get Mallory Square. Complimentary breakfast the next morning was freshly brewed coffee/tea fresh juice as well as pastries, yogurt, toast, bagels boiled eggs etc etc. The wonderful owners were so helpful in trying to make our stay as pleasant as possible. On returning from shopping on the busy Duval St. it was such a treat to return to this relaxing peaceful setting. I recommend this Inn for it's location (park the car and thats it... you're right at Duval), all the amenities, the cleanliness and the ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “A repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: miatraveller
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times and always enjoy the visit. Friendly, helpful staff; excellent location; beautiful surroundings and a new nice touches, like complimentary happy hour each evening. Especially great value in the off-season!

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: slim54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our third trip to KW and the Almond Tree. We enjoyed another great stay. The overall atmosphere is very relaxing. Our room was very clean, the staff is wonderful and we returned to MI very relaxed! Even though the inn feels very private, we have met other guests and enjoyed talking with them during breakfast or happy hour. We are already looking forward to our "Almond Tree Getaway" next year! Thanks to Bill and his great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, destination to enjoy Key West”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegPrairiedog
Reviews.Content: If only for the location, the Almond Tree Inn would merit a good rating. It's just a few steps from Duval Street, where any visitor's exploration of Key West likely begins. But there is much more to recommend here. The property achieves welcome seclusion from the busy surrounding streets by way of gates (not imposing), tall trees (lit up romantically at night), lush flora, and a small man-made pond stocked with fish and producing the soothing sound of trickling water. All of these form the surroundings for a common area that includes a warm and good sized swimming pool and a patio area to enjoy the daily happy hour. Here it's easy to mix with other guests, or return to your room with some snacks and cold drinks. Noise was never a problem and our suite (Room 112) was incomparably comfortable. We enjoyed our stay here immensely, and it was enhanced by the genial attitude of Bill, the proprietor. We learned a lot about the property and about Key West chatting with him.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we'd stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Funtastic
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Almond Tree but loved it. The room was lovely - very clean with everything you could need and space to sit and chill outside on the shared balcony area overlooking lovely grounds/pool. Staff was friendly and gave some good recommendations on where to eat/drink. The location is great too - right on the corner with Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for our Group of Executives”
Reviews.Author: PlanetTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with our group which was assembled from all over the country. Overall comments received back from our entire group included: â€œFriendly & Helpful Staff, Spacious & Comfortable Well Appointed Guest Rooms, Great Proximity to Duval Street, Better than many other hotels in Key West that we have stayed atâ€� Overall this hotel proved itself to be an excellent choice for our gathering and everyone was pleased with the property and onsite ammenities. Many guests in our group said they will be returning again to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Almond Tree Inn!”
Reviews.Author: ian1085
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree Inn was the perfect place for our romantic getaway... friendly staff, great breakfast and happy hour when you can meet other guests. Pool and hot tub are lovely and the rooms are beautifully decorated. Perfect place to stay and GREAT location right next to the action of Duvall Street. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “very romantic”
Reviews.Author: diceburner
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night and they gave us a suite for 180.00 USD. It is pricey but the Courtyard Marriot when you first enter Key West and therefore far away from everything was charging 219.00. I guess in Key west if you want to stay in the middle of the action you have to pay for it,and 180.00 USD seemed to me a decent deal for a suite.Will go back

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: Lilysnap
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree is the perfect place to stay in Key West. They have a FREE happy hour nightly from 5-7, including snacks, wine, and beer. The pool area is serene and beautiful. We went with 4 other couples and there was almost no need to ever leave the hotel. Next door is a CVS in case you forgot anything and just a few feet away is Duval Street, where you can find all kinds of shopping/entertainment/restaurants. The owner was on-site daily and it showed. We have never been treated better or had a better time for such a reasonable price. Will definitely return for many years to come!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are correct”
Reviews.Author: DarlaT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Key West and already are planning a return trip. I read all the reviews on the hotel and concur with the writers who sing its praises. The staff was so courteous, the room is newly furnished, a nice size, the bath is very clean, there was a room safe, refrig, etc. The grounds were immaculate, including the jacuzzi and the pool. The contintental breakfast was just enough. We didn't take the time to do the cocktail party as we were just there for a few days but heard it was nice. If there is any doubt where to stay, don't pass this one up. It is in a great location and it is very quaint and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Generous spirited hospitality”
Reviews.Author: minkydLondon
Reviews.Content: Arrived for one night, stayed for four, wish it could have been longer... next time it definitely will be. Friendly and charming with a true sense of hospitality so rare today. A gem!

Reviews.Title: “great little oasis”
Reviews.Author: salsham04
Reviews.Content: Lovely place to stay, we stayed 3 nights and can not fault the Inn. The rooms are scented and have all amenities you could wish for, and the hosts are very helpful. The hot tub is a great place to unwind at the end of the day. Happy Hour good , as good selection of snacks as well as the wine, beer etc. Thouroughly recommend this place. Also so close to Duval St, and has own car park so you can leave the car and forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “I miss it already!”
Reviews.Author: earlebee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn during the early part of Fantasy Fest. It was an absolutely wonderful place. The room was clean, well-decorated, and quiet. We had a deluxe king overlooking the pool which is open 24hrs. How great is that after a hot nite on Duval? The bathroom is small but cool. Good size fridge and microwave in room. The courtyard is an oasis. The pool and fish pond are lovely. You would never know that you are at one of the busiest crossroads in the Keys. If you feel cramped in your room, you can always take advantage of the outdoor living spaces. Breakfast every morning was perfect - the kind of stuff you eat at home- hardboiled eggs, toast, pastries, yogurt, fruit, great coffee and served with a friendly smile. The happy hour was just in time. Wine, beer, snacks and the ever present friendly smile. The staff that we met - Trudy, Galina, Bruce and Bill the owner were so nice, helpful and full of good humor. Even the groundskeepers were friendly and kept the property meticulously clean and maintained. The hotel is well located but still a bit of a hike from the downtown/Mallory Square. We rented bikes from the place right across the street. Reasonable rates and nice bikes. We loved the Almond Tree Inn - facilities, ambiance, service, location. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Almond Tree!”
Reviews.Author: debadoo
Reviews.Content: The Almond Tree is fantastic! While the location is a little further up Duval Street then I would have liked, the amenities more then made up for it. Every morning you get a continental breakfast and every evening they have beer, wine and snacks for "happy hour" to get you started on your evening. The pool and room were spotless. The only suggestion I would make is to consider getting the "suite" over the regular room - it was a little cramped for two people for five nights.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: mimandcarl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Keys and this hotel was a keeper! Away from the hustle and bustle surrounded by waterfalls- and highwalls- Loved the XM radio piped to the courtyard! We loved it! Here you can have it all - a get away that is private as well as the liveliness of Duval just around the corner. The staff was courteous and responded to every need. The continental breakfast and the happy hour are such a plus! We had a nice refrigerator and microwave - which was helpful with leftovers when you are on a budget and the rooms are quite clean. I want to thank Galina for her sweetness -leaving shells and beads as well as Trudy for her helpfulness with any activities we were interested in. You cant go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “3rd Visit to this Wonderful Inn”
Reviews.Author: orlandobeck
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the Almond Tree since June 2004. We also stayed for Christmas 2005 and this most recent visit in May 2006. I don't think I'll ever stay anywhere else in Key West. The rooms are beautiful( we have a 9 yr old son so we always stay in a suite). The pool and spa are perfect. The breakfast and happy hour are very enjoyable. This time we traveled with my husband's folks ,one of whom has mobility issues so the new elevator allowed us to have suites together on the same floor. The "retreat" on the upper level is a great place to relax and you can even see the lighthouse from up there. The best thing about this little paradise is the staff. Everyone is friendly and helpful! Bill,the owner ,even had a Christmas gift for my son when we stayed at Christmas! To me, that is a personal touch that you don't find just anywhere! I can't wait until our next visit! I recommend this inn to anyone going to Key West! It is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Clean”
Reviews.Author: sharches
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay . We will definitely revisit this Inn. The rooms are beautiful and clean. Excellent location to the areas attractions. Staff was friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sue0
Reviews.Content: Key West on an average budget? This is the place. Open plan bedroom with nice bathroom. Bit like an upper class motel with a tropical garden. Great happy two hours, free wine, beer and snacks, great idea. Also continental breakfast. Very clean and nice atmosphere. Ideal for all the hot spots. Bit of a rush for sun beds over the weekend, but empty during the week.

Reviews.Title: “SimplyThe Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Magali_1978
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at the Almond Tree Inn for a weekend at KeyWest. Both of us were very skeptical, but the place is AWESOME!!! Very inexpensive and full of luxories. Excellent Loctaion and a Super Friendly Staff. Would not stay anywere else from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Love the Almond”
Reviews.Author: cosita76
Reviews.Content: For Memorial Day Weekend, I originaly booked (and stayed two nights) at the Holiday Inn. It was not bad at all (recently remodeled after the hurracaines, it looks OK outside but the rooms are nice and the services is good)... but I found it to be too far from all the action (which I read here on TripAdvisor but didnt pay attention to) and after a couple of nights it stared to bother me that you had to drive everywhere, and we moved closer to Duval Street to the Almond Hotel. We stayed at Almond Tree Inn for two nghts and it was awsome! The rooms are beautiful, it was quiet (they had parking available) and they have a pool & a jacuzzy. They also had complementary breakfast as well as a complimentary "happy hour" with wine & cheese and the location is great, only 1/2 block from Duval street where all the action in Key West takes place. Im planning my next trip there and without a doubt will stay there. I highly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the almond tree for the last 4 years and it always measures up!! Great staff, especially Trudy, very clean rooms and great location! Very quaint and quiet hotel. It is close enough to Duval Street bars and attractions but just far enough that you dont have all the noise like you would staying right on Duval. I highly recommend this hotel!!! Always pleased everytime we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great place, in a great location! Will be staying here next time we go to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Almond Tree”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from the internet and was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The rooms are large and clean with a small kitchenette. The pool area is small, but nicely kept and intimate. Continental breakfast every morning served from 7-10AM and cocktail hour from 5-7pm were very nice. The owners are very accommodating and can't do enough to make the stay pleasurable. If you are looking for a hotel that is large and impersonal, this is not the place to stay. This is a small and welcoming hotel with the perfect location, just far enough away from the noisey bars on Duval, but within walking distance of most everything. I can't wait to go back to Key West and when I do, I will stay at the Almond Tree. I will recommend this lovely hotel to everyone I know who will be traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: daveb7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed at the Almond Tree last week. The location is perfect. We had a king suite that was very nice. Spotless. Large king bed and the most comfortable pullout sofa/bed my wife and I ever slept in. Fridge and safe were also a nice addition. We did not spend much time in the room but found it very comfortable for 4 adults. The pool area is great. Water temp was perfect. Enjoyed the happy hour one evening. Spoke to several other guests who were very nice. The staff was also very nice. Very helpful and friendly. I left some medication in our room after checkout and they called me on my cellphone to tell me they found it. Had a good breakfast at Diner Shores one morning(Banana Cafe was closed). Also ate at Jimmy Buffetts, Conch Republic Sea Food Co., The Pier House and the Hilton. All good. We would stay at the Almond Tree again. Liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Perfect location. Large attractive, clean room. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Almond Tree was a great place for our honeymoon! The rooms are very cute, clean, and well kept. A little small, but it had everything we needed, it was perfect! Happy hour was awesome and the staff is wonderful! you have to eat at Blue Heaven and Pepe's! AWESOME food! Also, get the key lime pie from One Duval (at the Pier House) We had a wonderful time and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent rememberance!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We come from Holland and we visited the Almond Tree Inn during our tour trouch the south of Florida, the first week of May 2005; it was a very pleasant surprise!! We can recommend this Hotel to all our friends and family!! We will thank the concierge (remember the 'button'? :) for his service; the happy-houre was great (we were a little late butt still he gave us a view free beer). We had a big laugh with him! The room was excellent and we had a fabulous swimm during the night. Key West is the Best and we will surelly visit again!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: royt5
Reviews.Content: I am very excited to tell you that my wifeâ€™s and my 3 day stay at The Almond Tree Inn was fabulous. After searching through the reviews on Tripadvisor.com and actually other sites as well, we decided to cast our lot with this great place to stay in Key West. It is located right off of Duval Street on Truman. It was so convenient. We walked every where that we wanted to go. There is a Denneyâ€™s right across the street, a Subway and a Papa Johnâ€™s Pizza, as well as a CVS drugstore in a strip mall directly next door. Also, it is only about a 3-4 block walk to Camilleâ€™s, or Blue Heaven restaurants. They are both great places to eat, and we enjoyed our meals very much. If you decide to rent a motorscooter or bike, you can do that right across the street, also. After planning this trip for several months, our arrival was scheduled on July 10th, which was right after Dennis had come through. We had been in Fort Lauderdale since the 8th, and called on Sunday to see if we could change our dates by one day. Carlos said that he would change our arrival date, and that we could actually check into the hotel any time that we got there, which was very good news to hear. Carlos, Jim and the rest of the staff pampered us and all the rest of the guests for our complete stay. Nothing we asked was to big a task for them to handle. A continental breakfast was served every morning from 8 to 10:30 AM and contained many pastries, cereal, bagels and the like as well as coffee and juice. In fact, the menu changed a little each day, which made it interesting wondering what we would have each morning. Also, a happy hour was there for anyone that wanted it every evening from 5 to 7 PM. Snacks of all kinds, and wine or beer was available. And as far as I could tell, they didnâ€™t care if you came back for the 2nd and 3rd beers or glasses or wine either. The rooms were excellent. We had a deluxe king bedroom and it was immaculate. Even furnished bathrobes. In fact, my wife liked the robes so much, she wound up buying two of them. The grounds were excellent. A beautiful fish pond was on the property containing many great looking fish. There was a nice small swimming pool, as well as a hot tub. And we were able to leave our car parked most of the time we were there, with the furnished parking lot. If you can find or if you know of a better place to spend your time and get as much for your money while in Key West, I would like to know about it. We donâ€™t know when we might be going back to Key West, but when and if we do, The Almond Tree Inn is where we will be staying. I tried to download pictures with this review, but kept getting an error message when I hit send, so I can't help you there. Hope this review helps someone else make up their mind, because I know what I went through, trying to decide on a place to stay without ever visiting Key West. We think and know that we made a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place, small, cozy with friendly attentive staff. The room was large and very clean. (we had double queens and and a pull out for our family of 5) There is a 'happy hour' from 5-7 each night with wine and beer and a few snacks. A nice way to wind down from a day out, hanging out around the pool chatting. Breads and bagels, coffee and juice in the mornings. The pool is clean, the landscape well maintained. It is within walking distance to downtown. Scooter and bicycle rentals across the street. Our thank you to Bill and Shea for the wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay..recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Almond Tree through trip advisor for our 15th anniversary trip. Would definitely go back. We were extremely happy with the room, location, and the service...stayed on the second floor. The happy hour was great, but we only made it back to it one time during our stay. Our only complaint was with the weather, but they couldn't help us there!! Cold spell, so we didn't use the pool..just the hot tub. Our departing flight was delayed due to airline issues and the staff allowed us to use their phone many, many times, they checked flight status on-line and accomodated all of our needs even after we checked out ..also let us use a room to change our clothing for the trip home. Excellent customer service... it makes all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Leave your car in the lot, and Walk to all the fun!”
Reviews.Author: lives4shore
Reviews.Content: Small, cozy motel, very clean property, friendly staff. A relaxing home base while enjoying Old Town! We parked our car at arrival and didn't return to it until checking out! We walked to everything. Hotel is practically at the corner of Duval and Truman, but step inside the gate and you wouldn't even know it. It is about 15-20 minute trek to Mallory square, but lots of shops and restaurants along the way. Trolley tour stop at the corner, moped rentals across the street. Our room (double queen suite) was very quiet and had a nice sitting area. Bathroom was tastefully decorated, however I found the shower space a bit narrow. Pocket doors to separate toilet/shower area from sink is great. The pool area, although on the small side, is beautifully hidden from the parking lot and street with foliage, gates, and a small fish pond/fountain. Almond Tree is conveniently located, yet far enough from the crazy Key West nite life that you can leave it behind when you've had your fill. Don't expect large spacious grounds, everything in Key West is tight. One note, no elevator so request a ground floor room if you don't want to carry your bags upstairs. Staff was very helpful, they have loads of information in the lobby if you want to arrange any tours of any kind but no pressure or sales pitch. Yours for the look-see if you like. No staff on-site late at night, so I could see the noise level would be subject to the courtesy of other guests. We loved our stay and will definitely return! Almond Tree Inn is truly a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Almond Tree for our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. We were also there over Memorial Day so expected it to be crazy but it was pretty calm. It is so close to all of the action but far enough down Duval to still be quiet. The staff was so nice and helped us make reservations on several different tours. The only thing is it is VERY hot in May - you sweat constantly. Other than the heat (the bar crawls will make you forget about that) the keys are beautiful and we did something different everyday. It is only a 10-15 minute walk to Mallory Square. You have to eat at El Mason Pepe (or something like that - it is a GREAT Cuban restaurant) at the end of Duval - by Mallory Square. I would definitely recommend this hotel - the rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. It looks like it was renovated in the last few years everything looks new. The pool is great and they offer a happy hour in the afternoon with wine, beer & snacks that is very nice. Stay here the next time you are in the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Almond Tree Inn, we were so happily surprised. The rooms are decorated in "Tommy Bahama" style furniture and has little surprises like Bed Bath & Body Works toiletries and FABULOUS robes. The pool is open 24 hours and is immaculate. The service is friendly and accommodating. The 2 hour happy hour with wine, beer, beverages, cheese and snacks is the best way to start your night in Key West before the sunset activities. Shea welcomes you during that happy hour as well as serves you for the 3 hour continental breakfast. The best part is that you are in walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn! Great location! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: like2travel1
Reviews.Content: The is the second time my wife and I stayed here, and we love the place. The first time we stayed here we had a standard room with a king size bed and the room was a little crowded. This time we had a Deluxe room which was so large it had two queen size beds and a full size sofabed, and still plenty of room to move around. All of the rooms are nicely furnished and decorated. The courtyard has a very nice pool, breakfast area, and lounging area with lounge chairs. Our breakfasts were very, very nice, served buffet style, with freshly cut fruit, croissants, bagels, breads, sweet rolls, hard boiled eggs and numerous other items. One of the staff constantly attended to it, even making sure our coffee cups always remained full. The afternoon wine and cheese get together also was very nice. All of the staff were really great and very helpful with making recommendations on restaurants and things-to-do. Although the inn is located on busy Truman Avenue, the courtyard is enclosed in such a way that the inn is very private and quiet. We believe this is one of the best inns in Key West and give it a very high recommendation. For anyone interested in butterfly's, there's a very nice Butterfly Conservatory on Duval Street, just a few blocks walk from the inn. For anyone who has never been to a Butterfly Conservatory, we recommend this as something very different and interesting to do.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we "Lucked out"”
Reviews.Author: SubaruDriver
Reviews.Content: Turned up on spec and the only room they had was a suite, but they did us a great deal and I'm so glad we stayed. Randy - the guy at the hotel was fantastic - he recommended places to go, places to eat, would make reservations and the like - couldn't be helpful enough. Thanks! Room was massive, the bathroom was covered in glass bricks and the basins outside of the bathroom made shaving easy and not fogged up whilst the wife showered. Nice little touch. The bed was massive and extremely comortable - a safe, iron / board - complimentary bottled water and Oreos were great and added a little something. The L shaped pool was nice, as was the jacuzzi and the fact the staff would put towels on the loungers for you. The pool is a 24 hour pool....... Only 1/2 block from Duval, yet when you get into the courtyard you feel a mile away. how relaxing. $5 a day for parking is not too bad I guess, especially when you consider free beers / wine and nibbles from 5 to 7 everyday. Loved it, just wont give any place 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and family just spent 5 days at the Almondtree Inn to celebrate my wedding in Key West. We took over the hotel with approximately 15 of the 21 rooms. My husband and I have been going to the keys for many years now and always bounced around to different hotels and Inns. This by far was the best place we have ever stayed there. We are planning a future trip in the Fall and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. The location is fantastic. We loved hanging around the pool area and I especially enjoyed walking right outside our room for breakfast. The rooms are decorated so well, too. The hotel and staff took great care to make sure everything was perfect. I couldn't have asked for better accomodations. This is a must stay if you are visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Almond Tree Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 evenings @ the Almond Tree. Cannot rave enough about the place. We had originally planned to only stay 3 nights but fell in love with the place in about 10 minutes and booked an additional 2 nights. Since we couldn't stay in our room they bumped us up to a suite at no additional charge. Nightly happy hour is great, so is the breakfast. It is right in the heart of everything but quiet and serene. We truly relaxed here. I would recommend this place to anyone. Thanks again for a great trip!

HotelInfo.Name: Almond Tree Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 512 Truman Avenue, Key West, FL 33040
